The swash plate is made of aluminum, preferably with less than 10% silicon, and is coated with a heat-curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load-bearing additive. The coating is applied by spraying an unlinked polyfluoro elastomer solution onto the swash plate surfaces and then curing it at an elevated temperature. The coating provides a low coefficient of friction and high durability, allowing for the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum alloys. The coating also eliminates the need for metal plating or high finish polishing of the swash plate. The preferred coating is Fluorolon™325, which is a PTFE-based coating with a 70% liquid portion and a 30% solid portion, consisting of 50% lubricious additive and 50% load-bearing additive. The coating is preferably cured at 450°F for about 10 minutes.

The present invention provides novel organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, particularly for photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF). These polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent the standing wave effect and light reflection, and to eliminate rear diffraction and reflected light from lower layers. The polymers are prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, or novolac resin with diazonaphthoquinone halide in the presence of an amine. The invention also provides anti-reflective coating compositions containing these polymers, alone or in combination with light-absorbing compounds such as anthracene derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, and fluorene derivatives. The anti-reflective coatings formed from these compositions are spectroscopically stable under conventional photolithographic conditions and exhibit superior anti-reflective effects when used with ArF, E-beam, extreme ultraviolet (EUV), and ion beam light sources.

The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10 to 350 μm. The film comprises at least one white pigment, at least one UV absorber, and at least one flame retardant. The film has good orientability and thermoformability, very good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively. The invention also relates to the use of this film and a process for its production.

The present invention provides a method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis. The process uses a molar ratio of hydrogen fluoride (HF) to 142b of greater than 1:1, and preferably greater than 2.5:1, in the presence of a catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, and which may or may not include a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt, and manganese salts. The process is carried out at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 100° C. and 250° C., and more preferably between 120° C. and 200° C. The contact time is between 1 and 100 seconds, preferably between 5 and 15 seconds. The pressure is between 1 atmosphere and 200 psig, preferably between 1 atmosphere and 150 psig. The catalyst has to be activated first using nitrogen, air, or HF/142b at a temperature between 100° C. and 650° C., preferably between 200° C. and 500° C. The process can be carried out in a continuous, plug flow adiabatic reactor.

This invention relates to an improved process for the preparation of certain pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors. The improvement comprises a deacylation and desulfurization step conducted in the presence of hypophosphorous acid. Use of hypophosphorous acid reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and the amounts of sulfur-containing organic impurities which are formed when hypophosphorous acid is not used in the reaction mixture. For example, if hypophosphorous acid is not used in a process for making the compound produced in Example 1, the thione and disulfide impurities corresponding to formulas 8 and 9 can be produced in significant levels; 5-15 area percent as determined by LC/MS (liquid chromatography/mass spectrographic analysis). Without the hypophosphorous acid, the product of Example 1 is prepared in comparatively low yield, 45-50%. Apparently, the low yield is due to formation of the undesired impurities mentioned above. In contrast, when the process of Example 1 is used, the desired pyrazolotriazole can be produced in 82% yield and with a purity of 98 area % by HPLC (high pressure liquid chromatography). The use of hypophosphorous acid in the process of this invention has several advantages besides reducing the amounts of undesirable by-products and increasing the yield of the desired product. For example, use of hypophosphorous acid results in formation of H2S by-product rather than sulfur. In view of the gaseous nature of H2S and its chemical reactivity, it is readily removed from the reaction zone and trapped, for example, by caustic and sodium hypochlorite. Furthermore, hypophosphorous acid does not reduce nitro groups which are commonly present on side chains in photographic intermediates, or affect other functional groups in the molecule. In summary, this invention overcomes significant difficulties and provides several advantages. For these reasons, and because the process is straight-forward and economical to carry out, it is readily adaptable by industry.

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially taking small partial quantities from different fiber lots, such as fiber bales. The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each stored fiber lot before each pass of the bale opener, determining a certain partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity, and continuously removing only the determined partial quantity from the measured fiber lot. The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener based on signals from the quantity measuring device. The control device may include a computer and a timer to ensure that the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than by the end of a predetermined period.

The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel yarn courses, using a rake system that moves opposite to the conveyor direction to place yarns onto or between conveyor needles. The rake system can move a full course width or a fraction of it, allowing for partial overlap of return courses onto first courses.

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, where different weft threads require different weft carrying forces. The apparatus includes a main nozzle unit and subnozzles, which can be supplied with air under different pressures or for different intervals of time, depending on the selected weft thread. This ensures that each weft thread is carried through the warp shed with an appropriate weft carrying force, preventing undue consumption of pressurized air and reducing weft insertion failures.

The invention provides a process for spinning bast fibers and a multi-fiber yarn obtained through blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers. The process involves twice health-preserving bast fibers, which improves their flexibility and spinnability, reducing end breakage rates. The process can be used for various bast fibers, including jute, kenaf, hemp, and combinations thereof. The multi-fiber yarn can be produced by blending health-preserved bast fibers with other fibers, such as cotton, terylene, polypropylene, or ramee, before spinning.

The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which comprises strategically-placed sensors that measure pressure at multiple cross-directional positions along the roll. The sensors are spaced apart circumferentially to account for rotational variability caused by the high-speed rotation of the roll. The invention allows for the calculation and display of a nip pressure profile that is more accurate than those obtained using a single sensor at each cross-directional position. The invention also allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, which provides additional real-time information about the dynamics of the pressure readings. The sensors can be arranged in various patterns, such as continuous helices or partial helices, to provide multiple pressure readings at each cross-directional position. The invention can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll. The data obtained from the arrangement of sensors can also be used to calculate and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile using other models, such as curve fitting. The invention can be used in various industries, such as paper manufacturing, textile manufacturing, and plastic foil manufacturing.

The invention is an apparatus for supporting an electrical cord of an electrical appliance and holding an article, particularly useful for an ironing board. It comprises a releasable clamp to secure the apparatus to the ironing board, a flexible cord support to hold the electrical cord above the ironing surface, and a detachable article holder to store items like spray starch cans or beverage containers. The clamp is 'C' shaped with an upper leg portion engaging the ironing surface and a lower leg portion with an adjustment screw to secure the apparatus to the ironing board. The cord support is a flexible mast with a helical bent portion at the top to receive the electrical cord, a coiled spring resilient section, and a foot at the bottom pivotably and slideably received by an opening in a brace mounted on the clamp. The article holder has a lower circular hoop, support bars, an upper hoop with tangs, and vertical supports. It is detachably mounted to the clamp via a second brace with 'U' shaped bends that receive the tangs of the upper hoop. The apparatus also includes an 'L' shaped bracket with an electrical outlet to receive the plug from the iron. The cord support can be retracted for storage, and the article holder can be detached for easy removal.

<summary>
The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for sewing machines that ensures buttonhole stitching closes without overlap, regardless of the type of material being sewn. The device includes a foot pad attachable to a presser bar and a travelling assembly with an initial position defined by oppositely acting springs. The travelling assembly moves with the work during buttonhole sewing and includes a slidable member positionable by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn. This slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine, limiting the length of the buttonhole to that suitable for the inserted button. An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing an operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping stitches. The device is particularly useful for sewing machines that form buttonholes in two halves, with top bar and left leg stitches first, followed by bottom bar and right leg stitches. The travelling assembly includes an anchor element with a 'V' notch to center one side of a round button and a gaging element with a complementary 'V' notch for centering and locating the button. An adjustable stop with a screw and knob allows the operator to fine-tune the buttonhole length by adjusting the screw's position relative to the tripping lever. The device ensures that buttonholes are sewn correctly, even with different types of materials that may slip differently relative to the feed dog.</summary>

The invention relates to an apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution. The apparatus includes a conveyor with an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a substantially horizontal path, a liquid applicator at a first station for applying the liquid to the web, a suction device at a second station downstream of the first station for removing the liquid from the web, and a dwell stretch between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop. In one embodiment, the dwell stretch is an air pass with freely rotatable rollers guiding the web in vertically extending loops above the upper section of the sieve belt. In another embodiment, the dwell stretch includes a freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt, with the dwell loop extending around the drum, and at least two rollers disposed laterally adjacent to one another below the drum for guiding the web to and from the drum. The suction device is preferably disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt to cause the textile web to adhere to the belt and be entrained thereby. The apparatus can have a compact construction if the textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt. The apparatus can include multiple assembly units spaced along the path defined by the upper sieve belt section, each assembly unit comprising a liquid applicator, a dwell stretch, and a suction device. The textile web passes through multiple dwell loops in the air pass or around the drum in each assembly unit, allowing the applied liquid more time to act on the substances to be removed from the web.

The dry cleaner of the present invention features an air flow system that draws ambient air into the machine through the access opening whenever the door is opened, minimizing the escape of toxic solvent vapors. This system is separate from the air recirculating system used during the drying cycle and includes an intake fan and duct interposed between the access opening and the open ends of the interior tubs, with a normally closed valve isolating the intake system from solvent vapors during normal machine operation. When the access door is opened, the intake fan is energized and the valve is opened, drawing air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct, with only the vapor immediately adjacent the open end of the tubs commingling with the intake air and lost to atmosphere. This design retains most of the vapors within the tubs and minimizes solvent loss. The machine also includes a separate solvent flow system that pumps solvent from a storage tank through filters into the tubs, with diverter valves controlling the flow path during different portions of the cleaning cycle. During the fill and wash portion, the solvent is continuously recirculated through the filters, while during the drain and spin portion, the solvent is drained from the tubs and pumped back to the storage tank through a separate path. During the tumble dry with heat portion, the solvent flow system is isolated from the evaporative air circulated during the dry cycle. The machine also includes a refrigeration system for condensing solvent vapors in the condenser box and maintaining the liquid solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature. The refrigeration system has a single compressor for alternatively cooling two distinct evaporator coils under either a continuously timed demand for one coil or a cyclical temperature responsive demand for the other coil, with the time demand having precedent. The machine's controls include a timer mechanism that controls the operation of the machine during the various portions of the cleaning cycle, and a "cartridge dry" switch that allows the filters to be dried within the machine prior to being discarded to reclaim any residual solvent or solvent vapors therein.

The invention describes a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments and forming nonwoven webs. It combines aspects of eductive and non-eductive systems, using a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments. The quench fluid, usually air, is used for both quenching and drawing the filaments, and the drawing force is developed in the impingement slot. The filaments are then deposited onto a moving mesh wire belt conveyor to form a web, which can be bonded and wound into rolls for shipping. The system offers advantages such as better control of cross-machine uniformity, simpler process equipment, and easier cleaning compared to conventional systems.

The sewing machine 1 is provided with three receivers 94, 95, and 96, and the ultrasonic pen 92 is not provided with an electromagnetic wave output circuit. The sewing machine 1 detects the ultrasonic wave using the three receivers and calculates the specified coordinates E based on the detection timings T2 of the receivers. The sewing machine 1 does not acquire the transmission timing T1 of the ultrasonic wave and does not use the transmission timing T1 when calculating the specified coordinates E. The distance ED between the specified coordinates E and the coordinates D of the receiver 96 is expressed by the coordinates B, C, D, and E based on the Pythagorean theorem, and the distance ED and the coordinates D and E satisfy a relationship of Formula (7). The distance ED can also be expressed by the propagation time Td using Formula (8).

<summary>
The present invention provides preparations for enhancing functional utility of cellulosic fabric materials, using wool particles or powder as carriers for functional additives, and bamboo fiber powder for moisture management. The wool particles, preferably of macrofibril size or below, demonstrate exceptional carrying and retention ability for functional additives, enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of cellulosic fabric materials. The preparations are applied onto the fabric materials by printing, padding, or foam application methods. The functional additives include anti-UV agents like zinc oxide or titanium oxide, anti-bacterial agents such as nano-silver, zinc oxide, titanium oxide, or non-charcoal bamboo powder. The bamboo fiber powder, preferably ultrafine with a particle size of less than 1 μm, improves moisture management properties of the fabrics. The binding agent used is acrylic copolymer based, and the carrier agent comprises wool particles or wool powder of macrofibril size and below. The cellulosic fabric material can be cotton or linen, and the preparation can be bonded or deposited onto the fabric by printing, padding, or foam application. The method of preparing the preparation involves pulverizing wool or bamboo fiber into ultrafine powder, forming a suspension, adding functional additives, and mixing with a binding agent. The method may also involve ultrasonic crushing and homogenization for better dispersion and carrying of functional additives.
</summary>

The invention is a frame quilting machine with two separate computers: one for controlling the sewing machine functions and another for controlling the quilting table movement. This segregation allows for easier reprogramming of either function independently. The machine also includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, which can be hand-drawn on a monitor using a cursor moving apparatus. The pattern is then automatically converted into machine readable form and stored in the computer's memory.

The present invention is a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a durable three-dimensional image. The fabric is formed from a first precursor web with a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web with a second fibrous matrix, separated by a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim. The precursor webs are hydroentangled on a three-dimensional image transfer device to create the three-dimensional image. The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer, deterring excessive intermingling of the first and second fibrous matrices while providing sufficient resistance to delamination. The first and second fibrous matrices can be dissimilar, and the fabric can include apertures. The method can also include post-entanglement treatments and application of performance or aesthetic modifying compositions.

The invention provides a sewing machine with a device for feeding and sewing a strip of material onto a cut of fabric. The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip, contacted by the strip, and then retracted. The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter that activates a setting means for the stop, allowing for continuous operation and the sewing of relatively stiff strips of material without damaging the needle.

The invention describes a method for connecting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, where one or both are movable. The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces, overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both knit pieces, binding off the overlaid loops gradually, and repeating this process until the two pieces are connected.

The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material, and a method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material. The traction element comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, wherein the core strand of each stranded cable is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer. The production line comprises a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for the precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, at least one extruder for co-extrusion of the stranded cables in a flexible plastics material jacket, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller. The method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material comprises the steps of unwinding the stranded cables, degreasing and/or pretreating the stranded cables to improve the adhesion of the plastics material jacket, preheating the stranded cables to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material sheathing the core strands, and sheathing the stranded cables in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.

The invention relates to a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook, where the bobbin housing is secured against co-rotation and reverse rotation by holding means arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing. This arrangement minimizes hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop, particularly during its pull-back after maximum expansion. The holding means consist of a shoulder with front and rear side faces, a spring rod, and front and rear cams. The shoulder is formed by two projections on the bobbin housing, and the spring rod extends between the cams, cooperating with the rear side face of the shoulder to prevent co-rotation. A capsule release device is optionally provided to give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face and the spring rod for unhindered thread movement.

The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and materials using liquid silane inks with accelerants for increased setting or curing times. Four-component and five-component inks are used in electrospinning procedures to produce nanowires that can be used as components of composite materials such as electrode composites. The inks can also be used with other deposition techniques such as thin film deposition techniques. The invention also provides methods for producing electrically-conducting silicon-composite electrode materials using four-component and five-component inks.

The invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element. A tensioning lever biased by the departing thread and net weight determines the angular position of the braking element. A fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement connected to each tensioning lever allows for central control of thread tension across the entire creel. Additionally, a brake shoe can be activated by increased fluid pressure for rapid braking when the warping machine is shut off.

The present invention provides a sewing machine detector that uses light shielding discs to detect sewing machine needle position and speed, and a power indicating optical fiber to indicate power status without interfering with control circuitry. The detector is durable, compact, and reduces stress on optical fibers by supporting them linearly.

The invention relates to a process for continuously producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves partially coagulating and drawing the yarn, completing the coagulation, washing the yarn with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying and finishing the yarn. The washing step reduces the amounts of total sulfur, sulfur bound as sulfides, elemental sulfur, iron, zinc, and lead retained on the yarn to specified levels, resulting in a yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45. The process can be carried out with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min.

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for deaerating oxygen-treated pulp before washing, using a small, no-moving-parts deaeration tank with a tangential swirl-inducing inlet for filtrate from the washer. The tank is designed to be placed on top of or hung from the side of the oxygen reactor, with the same diameter as the reactor. The system includes a thick stock pump, steam mixer, oxygen mixer, open or closed pressure tower, deaeration tank, and pulp washer. The deaeration tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl-inducing filtrate inlet, with specific locations and sizes for optimal deaeration. The filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach is used as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank to maintain the consistency of the pulp at a pumpable consistency, typically around 3%.</summary>

<summary>
The invention provides biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite structures with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. These structures consist of spaced-apart stuffer members with tendon elements criss-crossing between them, connected to panels at their ends. The stuffer members and tendon elements can be embedded in a matrix material, and the panels can have various shapes and configurations. The stuffer members can be aligned in different ways, and the panels can have convex, concave, or flat outer surfaces. The tendon elements can be tied at their crossing points to form joints, and the stuffer members can be hollow with bent-wire tendon elements inserted into them.
</summary>

The invention is a load-limiting device for use in braced frames, designed to dissipate energy during dynamic events and limit loads transmitted to other parts of the structure. The device is releasably attached to a brace in the frame and provides biaxial support, able to undergo plastic deformation in response to high loads. It can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation, making it a cost-effective solution for protecting structures from seismic events. The device can be adapted to various frame configurations and geometries, making it versatile for different structural applications.

<summary>
The invention relates to a bedroom cabinet for use in flophouses, designed to be easily installed and stacked. The cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them for housing boxes and wirings. The outer casing has a flat external surface, and the inner casing contains a bed, shelves, and devices like an interphone or TV receiver. The cabinet is assembled by fitting the inner casing into the lower outer casing and then placing the upper outer casing on top, securing them with clips. A sheet covers the bed and can be wound for cleaning. In a second embodiment, spacers with vent grooves are placed between the outer casings and the inner casing to create a sound-proofing wall and air passage. The cabinet is strong, effectively utilizes space, and allows for easy installation and stacking.
</summary>

The invention provides a portable guard rail support and assembly for temporary safety barriers in construction sites. The guard rail support consists of a flat base plate, an upright column, rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The base plate can be anchored to a floor or ground surface, and the rail support brackets and retaining flange secure wooden guard rails and kick boards. The guard rail supports can be spaced along a drop-off edge to create a safety barrier. A concrete-filled steel base can also be used to receive the guard rail support when anchoring to a surface is not possible. The guard rail support can accommodate overlapping wooden rails or short stubs of stock lumber to secure the rails. A mesh-like fence structure can also be used with the guard rail supports to create a fence-like safety barrier.

The present invention is a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that uses a combination of electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) pulses to stimulate oil production from reservoirs. The device generates strong acoustic vibrations that travel through the reservoir, and an EM pulse that induces coupled acoustic vibrations at high frequencies, stimulating the reservoir at multiple scales. The invention includes a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of sources in one well, extending the effective range of stimulation. Multiple pulse sources in multiple wells can also be used to extend the range of coupled stimulation. The discharge characteristics of the pulse sources can be customized to produce specific frequencies that activate specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir. The invention also includes EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, allowing use in more sensitive wells. A directional energy cone can be used to focus the EH discharge in a specific direction. The pulse source can be placed in an injector well and bathed in water to maintain good coupling to the formation. The electrodes used in the EH discharge device have been improved to reduce wear and increase efficiency. The fluids produced from the wellbore can be separated into their components using various methods, including membrane separation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction.

The disclosure describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice consists of two wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat corresponding transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip. The plates are coupled together using connective devices, such as bolts and nuts, which also clamp down on the longitudinal wires of both elements, preventing them from escaping the splice. This allows for the creation of a composite soil reinforcing element with a desired length by connecting multiple grid-strips to a single soil reinforcing element using multiple splices.

The present invention relates to a plow blade design that provides fluid passage and ejection points, produced using basic manufacturing processes for efficient production. The blade can be a multiple component assembly, allowing for rebuilding and replacement of worn parts. The design allows for specific fluid ejection at specific points along the blade, adaptable to both static and vibratory plowing utilities, minimizing fluid volume while maximizing desirable characteristics. The flow paths are defined by stacking leading edge sections with flow voids and welding or attaching them to the blade, providing an easily tailored configuration. The blade can be adapted to include a manifold for fluid routing and control, and can be modified using hand tools without welding. The design protects the fluid tube by locating it on the rear side of the blade, between the blade and the chute, and sealing it with plates.

The MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall Cavity System is a masonry cladding system that meets performance requirements of the Building Code, including structural integrity, durability, spread of fire resistance, and external moisture resistance. The system comprises proprietary plaster reinforced with pre-papered hot dipped galvanized zinc steel wire mesh and other reinforcement, applied in three coats over mesh stapled to treated vertical timber battens. The system provides a nominal thickness of 21 mm with a standard sponge or plastic float finish, and is installed on timber framing protected by a building wrap and pre-qualified window sealing tape. The render is protected from the weather with a coating system complying with BQI interim Performance Standard C5031*. Components and consumables of the system are specified, including battens, wall wrap, flashing tape, powder coated aluminum Z flashings, plain aluminum Z flashing, mesh staples, batten nails, sealant, meter box angle, bolts, washers, PVC sleeve, saddle flashings, proprietary type 304 stainless steel joist hanger, fiber cement board, aluminum Z flashings and uPVC moldings, plaster and sealer, reinforcement, and mortar pumps. The system requires a continuous concrete foundation or slab edge thickening under all walls, and is intended to be fixed to timber walls with studs at 600 mm centers, heights up to 4.8 m, and dwangs spaced at up to 900 mm centers. The system is able to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones, and has a weight of 41 kg/m2 that does not contribute to the building lateral bracing. The system may be fixed to wet timber framing provided the interior lining and insulation are not installed until the framing moisture content is less than 18%. The location of movement control joints (VMCJs) shall be shown on the consented building elevations in compliance with the Rules, and VMCJs shall be provided at changes in elevation, at openings, and to break the length of a wall into sections no wider than 8 meters or 2.75 times the panel's height, all as required by the Rules hereafter. Horizontal movement control joints (HMCJs) shall be provided at intermediate floor level where the moisture content of flooring timbers or wall plates abutting the intermediate floor is greater than 18%, and checks on moisture content shall be conducted prior to plastering commencing to

The invention describes a safe with a unique door mechanism that slides in at an angle and then drops into place, secured by a lockbolt that engages a notch in the safe's wall. The door is reinforced with safety bolts to protect the lock mechanism from prying attempts.

The invention relates to measuring fluid pressures in geological formations more accurately by isolating the pressure sensor in a borehole to the formation pressure at a specific depth. This is achieved by cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole, clearing the conduit of cement grout during installation, and then using fluid injection to displace the cement grout around the filter and create a fluid connection between the formation and the filter. The pressure sensor is then connected to the conduit to measure the formation pressure at the desired depth. In one embodiment, the pressure sensor is installed permanently at the bottom of the conduit, while in another embodiment, the pressure sensor is removable and relocatable within the conduit. The invention also includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which involves forming a borehole, placing a conduit in the borehole, filling the borehole with a cementitious material, purging the inlet end of the conduit of cementitious material, forming a lateral fluid path between the inlet end of the conduit and the formation, and measuring the formation fluid pressure.

The present invention provides a jointing structure for vehicle traveling paths with expansion capabilities, featuring a joint block that blocks an expansion gap while allowing for expansion and contraction of bridge girders. This structure prevents tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensuring smooth vehicle travel. The joint block is supported by elastic members, such as laminated rubber, which absorb the expansion and contraction of the bridge girders. The joint block and supporting blocks can be easily maintained due to their detachable nature. The expansion gap can be further reduced by incorporating intermediate joint blocks, and the occurrence of tire fall-in and stuck-in situations can be minimized by providing oblique expansion gaps. A method for mounting the elastic members involves joining them together, fixing one side, deforming them towards the bridge girder axis, and then fixing the other side. This method allows for easy mounting of the elastic members without being affected by seasonal changes or bridge girder ages.

The invention provides enclosed floor track systems for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of fluid treatment chambers without contaminating the sanitary environment. The first embodiment features a wheel channel supported above the floor, with one sidewall extending higher than the other and a cover plate overlying the channel. This design prevents showered fluid from entering the wheel channel and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels. The cover plate can be pivoted away from the channel for cleaning. The second embodiment is adapted for trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure. It uses inflatable elastomer seals along the top edges of the channel sidewalls to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track. When inflated, these seals also act as a brake on the trucks. Both embodiments allow for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontamination.

The lock device comprises an engaging member with a hook part and a slot, supported by a pin and guided by a member, and an engaged member that engages with the hook part. The engaging member is held in the lock position or release position by touching the guide member with either a first or second surface. The guide member is slanted so that it does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated between its highest and lowest positions.

The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable platform that allows precise regulation of suction efficiency during cleaning. The platform has a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom using conveniently located adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head. The adjustment mechanisms regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central portion and the pool bottom, enabling real-time adjustment of suction without having to adjust the remotely located suction source. The invention also includes a kit form of the adjustment mechanisms that can be interconnected with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without the need for major retrofit.

The invention is a tool for retrieving wear bushings from oil wells, consisting of a sub-unit with a mandrel and collars, and a retriever section that slides along the mandrel and engages with the wear bushing. The retriever section has protruding members that fit into slots on the wear bushing, allowing it to be retrieved by rotating the drill string. The retriever section is free to move vertically along the mandrel, preventing damage to the wear bushing or the tool due to excessive weight below the retriever.

<summary>
The invention is a downhole vibratory tool that allows for wireline access through its central passage when not in use, and can be activated by dropping a simple, retrievable plug. The tool features stacked pistons to increase power delivery, an annular dump valve that avoids slamming against a seat, and a modular design that allows for customization based on specific job requirements. The tool can be operated to deliver high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces with or without impacts, depending on the applied overpull. The tool's components are designed to minimize wear and fatigue, and can be made more robust since they are not delivered on a dart. The tool can also be used for stimulation or fishing operations, and may include a rotational lock for torque transmission.
</summary>

The present invention provides a precast concrete retaining wall system with a modular design, consisting of a face panel with integral counterforts and a solid base. The face panel and counterforts are precast with reinforcing bars that extend into the base, which is also precast. The base is set on grade, and the face panel is set upright on the base with a connection joining them together. The connection is made by inserting the exposed ends of the reinforcing bars into openings in the base and sealing the connection with grout. The counterforts provide additional support and resistance to overturning moments, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases. The system is flexible and customizable, with the height or width of any of the individual components varying over a wide range. The base can be stabilized using H-piles, grout, or a cast-in-place pile cap, and a vehicle impact barrier can be formed and cast-in-place on top of or behind the wall.

The present invention is a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells that addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches: improper heat focus and inadequate protection of electrical components from down hole fluids. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods, a heat insulating packer, and stainless steel tubing collars to contain heat in the production zone. The heating unit's electrical connections are shielded from pressure and chemical attack by encasing them in a high temperature cement block and a welded steel fitting assembly. The method of use involves installing the system to focus heat on the producing formation and using cable instead of pipe for supporting the heating unit during well treatments or maintenance.

The invention is a downhole tool for installing and retrieving objects in wells, featuring a simple and efficient mechanism for connecting and disconnecting from objects. The tool consists of an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that move telescopically to engage or disengage with the object. A catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions controls the connection. The catch mechanism includes a pin that moves between locking and unlocking grooves, guided by a control spring that ensures alternate locking and unlocking each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly. The tool can be used as an external overshot or an internal spear, depending on the service operation. The tool can be latched and unlatched multiple times without removal from the well bore. If the tool is unable to accomplish a pulling operation, it can be unlatched and removed, then replaced with a tool of greater pulling capacity. The tool can also be used to install downhole tools. The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments disclosed and can be adapted for various downhole service operations.

<summary>
The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability and maintainability. The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The substrates are assembled together using glue and multidirectional holding means, which include dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane. The use of these holding means prevents displacement or change of dimensions between the substrates, and allows for corrective maintenance of the floor. The sight substrate can be obtained from decorative or functional substrate, wood cut in tangential or quarter form, preserving its natural seams and uniform physical resistance. The example embodiment also provides a composed stave floor with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the need for on-site glaze application. The floor can be manufactured using different types of clamps, such as knitted wire, clamps, or cemented clamps, or divergent legs. The example embodiment solves the problems of detachment and deformation found in conventional composed stave floors. The use of a thicker sight substrate allows for sanding or rushing without deformation or detachment, and the use of multidirectional holding means prevents displacement or change of dimensions between the substrates. The example embodiment provides a composed stave floor with increased durability and maintainability, preserving its physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
</summary>

The invention presents a ladder attachment that improves lateral stability, prevents damage to work surfaces, and allows the ladder to straddle corners. The attachment includes a brace with a resilient pad that pivots to contact work surfaces, and a clamp to secure the brace to the ladder. The brace can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes and can be used on both sides of the ladder.

The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The strip comprises a row of nails arranged parallel to each other and at an angle relative to the strip's axis, with a plastic collation system molded onto and adhered to the nails. The collation system includes an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, and is molded onto preheated nails to enhance adhesion. The strip can be coiled for use in certain tools, and the collation system is configured to minimize debris generation and reduce the tendency for the strip to corrugate or advance on itself in the tool magazine. The strip can also be configured with a weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, further reducing debris generation.

The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants like silicones, comprising a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button. The nozzle can be coupled to sealant cartridges or injection machines via a threaded connecting section. The bell-shaped section encapsulates rivets or nuts for complete coverage with sealing material. The injection button, fitted non-permanently to the bell-shaped section, has channels and orifices for precise sealing operations. The button can be removed and replaced at the user's will. The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene. The sealant application can be performed manually or using an injection machine. The nozzle simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and improves the quality of the sealant application.

The invention relates to a position sensor that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer using an error correction signal to provide a conditioned sensing signal. The error correction signal is generated by a circuit that constantly compares the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value, adjusting it in two directions based on the speed of the object being monitored. The sensor draws minimal current upon startup and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power, making it suitable for multiplexing with other sensors on a minimum number of wires.

The invention describes a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that eliminates the need for springs and allows for variable valve displacement. The system uses a rotating cam to initiate reciprocating motion, which is then converted into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion to control the valve. The system also includes a control block that captures an adjustment pin, allowing for precise control of the valve displacement.

The light member includes a housing with a top side facing away from an aquarium and a bottom side facing the aquarium, with a lighting control region on the bottom side having two control channels for different colors of light and a neutral channel. Light-emitting modules can be coupled to the lighting control region, with each module having electrical connectors that couple to one of the control channels and the neutral channel to emit light into the aquarium.

<summary>
The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade. The apparatus comprises a hollow casting with cooling channels separated by inserts acting as separating walls. The inserts are made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials and are inserted into holders in the form of rails within the apparatus. The inserts can be secured by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, for added security. The cooling fluid flows in opposite directions in adjacent channels and is deflected by U-shaped separating walls. The apparatus is particularly suitable for gas turbine blades, with the cooling channels and inserts extending radially. The inserts can be inserted through the blade root or tip and are preferably secured at the end close to the axis for rotor blades. The invention simplifies production, allows flexible cooling system adjustments, reduces blade weight and casting complexity, and eliminates thermal stresses between the hot-gas wall and inserts.
</summary>

The invention is a system for controlling a fuel delivery system in a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve. The system uses a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to automatically set the throttle position for optimal vehicle performance. The control unit also controls a clutch that connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve for manual control. The system ensures a smooth transition between automatic and manual control by waiting for the throttle valve to match the accelerator pedal position before switching control modes.

<summary>
The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter, operates with little slag or clinkers, can burn wet wood, and is self-regulating with fast response times. It forms a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel. Volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber with less than stoichiometric air, and then fully oxidized in a secondary combustion chamber with excess air. The primary chamber has an air-cooled flame holder that prevents particulate matter from entering the secondary chamber. The burner can also be used to clean and burn dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas. The control system adjusts air and fuel feed rates based on BTU demand, and trims swirl and secondary air based on temperature or oxygen levels.
</summary>

The invention relates to an evaporative air conditioning system that separates the dry and wet sides of a heat exchanger to cool air without adding water vapor. The system recirculates a major portion of the working air from the enclosure to be cooled, improving efficiency by utilizing air with a lower wet bulb temperature. The heat exchanger uses an array of spaced, vertically directed hollow tubes, with water flowing downwardly along the inner surfaces and working air flowing countercurrently. Fresh air passes through the dry side of the heat exchanger for cooling, and is then delivered to the enclosure. The system can also include a heat exchange assembly to pre-cool the fresh air using the exhaust air from the wet side. Additionally, a portion of the return air can be diverted to mix with the fresh air for faster cooling, or a portion of the cooled air can be diverted to mix with the working return air for lower temperatures. In a hybrid embodiment, a vapor compression refrigeration unit is used to dehumidify a minor portion of the cooled air, further enhancing the system's efficiency.

<summary>
The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series, with each pump head containing an impeller driven by a common drive structure. Fluid flows sequentially through each pump head, with the initial pump head drawing fluid from a reservoir and the final pump head expelling fluid. Each pump head comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn and at least two fluid conduits through which fluid is moved by the impeller. The fluid conduits combine into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head. The drive structure passes through the inlet between the pump heads and is configured to commonly drive the impellers. The pump heads may be removably connected or formed in a unitary structure. A pump assembly comprises a fluid pump mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer.</summary>

<summary>
An engine compression release brake system is disclosed for use with less than all engine cylinders. The system includes an engine housing defining multiple cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for a portion of the cylinders, which is less than all. Each brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve. The engine also includes a low pressure reservoir, a high pressure pump, and a high pressure manifold. A hydraulic system is provided, with an electronic control module controlling fuel injection timing and engine compression release brake timing. The engine compression release brake includes a brake body, an electrical actuator, a pilot valve member, a spool valve member, and a piston. The electrical actuator moves the pilot valve member to control fluid communication between a high pressure passage and a low pressure passage. The spool valve member moves based on fluid pressure in a spool cavity to control fluid communication between an actuation fluid passage and the high and low pressure passages. The piston moves based on fluid pressure in the actuation fluid passage to open the exhaust valve for engine braking. The system operates by activating the electrical actuator during the compression stroke of the piston to open the exhaust valve and vent compressed air, providing engine braking. The electrical actuator is then deactivated, allowing the exhaust valve to close and the system to reset. The engine can operate in a power mode or a braking mode, with cylinders not having an engine brake undergoing typical intake, compression, and exhaust strokes without fuel injection during braking. The system allows customers to choose the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application.</summary>

The invention relates to a link assembly between an engine and a gearbox, comprising a male link, a female link that receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening, and a pin to selectively retain the links. The gearbox assembly includes this link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox. The technical function is that the female link receives the male link to allow translation and form a radial interface for dampening, and a pin selectively retains the links. The link assembly dampens extreme loads, such as those caused by blade-off events, by allowing translation and providing coulomb damping at the radial interface, while the pin breaks to prevent detachment.

The present invention provides a lightweight, adjustable point cap system for archery arrows, comprising a point cap and a balance pin, which can be varied in size to achieve perfect balance. The point cap system reduces material and weight of the point or broadhead, making it suitable for slim graphite arrows. The invention also includes a point adaptor for attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter, and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft.

<summary>
The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronic device that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire for training purposes. It uses a pyrotechnic charge housed in an expendable magazine-like unit, which is inserted into a weapon such as an M16 rifle. The device has an electrical control circuit that interfaces with the weapon's trigger and bolt, providing automatic and semiautomatic fire modes. The circuit includes a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, and firing sensors. The firing control circuitry triggers the pyrotechnic charges in sequence, producing sound and flash through an exhaust port designed to mimic the weapon's ejection port. The device also interfaces with a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) for training purposes. The pyrotechnic charge is a shaped pellet composed of potassium perchlorate, black powdered aluminum, and dextrose, sealed within a plastic cup. The combustion of the charge produces overpressure levels and duration that simulate small arms fire. The device is designed to be reusable, with the expendable magazine being the only part that needs to be replaced after use.
</summary>

<summary>
An air intake device for an internal combustion engine includes a tank with two pipes connecting it to the intake passage, one with a larger cross-section and a valve, the other with a smaller cross-section. The valve opens or closes based on engine load, improving performance and reducing intake noise. The smaller pipe acts as a resonator, absorbing noise, and is preferably located near the air cleaner. The valve is controlled to open at high engine speeds and loads, enhancing performance. The device improves volumetric efficiency and reduces intake noise compared to conventional designs.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting objects like speakers to poles, walls, or other surfaces. The stationary bracket is mounted on the surface, and the adjustable bracket, attached to the object, is then secured to the stationary bracket. The adjustable bracket can be rotated and locked into various positions, allowing for easy and single-person installation. The stationary bracket can be mounted on poles using a chain and hook system, with adapters for different pole sizes. A speaker mounting bracket can be used to attach a speaker to the adjustable bracket. The bracket assembly is designed to be resistant to weather, wind, and vibration, making it suitable for outdoor use.
</summary>

<summary>
The disclosure presents a burner for a heat utilizing appliance and a system for interchangeable modular heat utilizing appliances. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder and around it to support secondary and tertiary combustion. The burner has legs, an ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover. The system includes modular heat utilizing appliances such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer, which can be removably coupled to the burner using manual couplings.
</summary>

The invention aims to improve the cooling and ignition system of a rotary internal combustion engine to reduce thermal distortion and structural failures. It achieves this by using staggered spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway, which allows for better coolant flow and heat transfer around the bosses. The bosses are offset but symmetrically oppositely oriented about a centerplane of the flow and skewed with respect thereto, promoting close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals while maintaining a controlled flow regime. The invention also incorporates flow diverters or controllers between the spark plug bosses to further enhance the controlled flow regime and strengthen the housing structure. The staggered boss configuration improves the heat transfer coefficient by at least 20% compared to the in-line arrangement, reducing hot spots and thermal distortion.

The present invention is a method to minimize flow disturbances caused by closing and reopening turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. It uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel valves, thereby minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes. The method determines flow as a function of control valve position and compensates for flow changes due to valve closure and reopening. It uses a test compensation circuit that adjusts flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance. The method has been successfully tested and shown to reduce pressure excursions by 95% compared to a system without flow compensation.

The invention describes a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources, water and soap solution, into one mixture. The valve allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids, ranging from 0% water, 100% soap solution to 100% water, 0% soap solution. The valve system is designed to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages for both water and soap solution, even when multiple identical valve systems are operated from a common source.

The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure while simultaneously performing work in an expansion turbine. The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and an electronic control system that operates the compressors and valves to achieve the desired compression and expansion. During summer operation, the gas is compressed in three stages, with a predominant portion of the compression taking place in two primary compression stages, and the excess pressure is reached in an additional compression stage. The compressed gas is then cooled and expanded in an expansion turbine, which is coupled to the booster compressor of the additional compression stage. During winter operation, the compressor station is operated differently by switching the valves to obtain a parallel operation of the compressors. The compressors of the second primary compression stage can be operated parallel with the compressors of the first primary compression stage, and additional compressors are available for use as needed during breakdowns or maintenance. The method and arrangement according to the present invention provide a more efficient and cost-effective solution for compressing gas in compressor stations, particularly in permanent frost areas, as compared to conventional re-cooling technology.

The text describes a cooling fan assembly that can be mounted to a panel without using fasteners. The assembly includes a motor with a non-rotatable housing and a motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions. The panel has recess portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs. The assembly is installed by inserting the turned-out portions of the resilient legs into the enlarged opening regions of the panel's openings, then applying a combined compressive and rotating force to move the assembly into a partially installed position, and finally rotating it further into a fully installed position where the resilient legs snap into the residual openings, securing the assembly to the panel.

<summary>
The invention provides kinematic mounts with damping features to protect instruments from damaging flight loads. The mounts use vibration damping materials to dissipate energy in the six suspension modes, preserving the mounts' strength, stiffness, and kinematic features. Damping mechanisms are placed at flexure locations, with two designs shown: a spherical damper using a viscoelastic (VEM) layer between two partial shells, and a cylindrical slot damper using VEM o-rings or washers. The mounts can be arranged in various patterns, with a truss structure or three damped mounts, and can use a single strut design for simplicity. The mounts can also be arranged to provide a center-of-gravity mounting system, with approximately uncoupled suspension modes. The damping materials have frequency-dependent properties, providing high stiffness at high frequencies (during launch) and low stiffness at low frequencies (on-orbit). The mounts can be made from titanium alloy and are applicable to a wide range of precision instruments.
</summary>

The invention relates to a large-scale oil shear type clutch unit for aircraft catapult systems, featuring separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment to minimize residual drag, auxiliary fluid pressure control for retraction and cooling, and easily removable clutch disc segments for maintenance. The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, interleaved clutch plates and discs, separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, and fluid pressure control means for simultaneous actuation. Auxiliary fluid pressure control means are provided for retraction and cooling, and the clutch discs are segmented for easy removal and replacement.

The invention describes an internal combustion engine with multiple cylinders, including combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, which are arranged in a cascade to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction. Water is injected into the expansion cylinders to create steam, which drives the pistons and further cools the exhaust gases. The engine is designed to minimize heat loss to the environment, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.

The invention provides a method for producing coated steel plates, blanks, and parts with improved mechanical properties and corrosion resistance. The method involves removing a portion of the metal alloy layer from the precoat of the steel plate, leaving the intermetallic alloy layer intact. The width of the removed area is between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the width of the intermetallic alloy layer is between 3 and 10 micrometers. The metal alloy layer can be removed by brushing or laser ablation. The steel plate has a composition that includes 0.10% to 0.5% carbon, 0.5% to 3% manganese, 0.1% to 1% silicon, 0.01% to 1% chromium, up to 0.2% titanium, up to 0.1% aluminum, up to 0.05% sulfur, up to 0.1% phosphorus, and 0.0005% to 0.010% boron. The steel plate is coated with an aluminum or aluminum-based alloy to form the precoat. The coated steel plate is then butt-welded to form a welded blank, and the welded blank is heat treated to form an intermetallic alloy compound and to confer a partially or totally austenitic structure on the steel. The welded blank is then hot-deformed to form a part, and the part is cooled at a rate adapted to confer the target mechanical characteristics. The resulting part has a microstructure that is martensitic, bainitic, or bainitic-martensitic, and the total elongation across the welded joint is greater than or equal to 4%. The method can be used to produce structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles.

The present invention is a remote control system for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) that enables navigation and automatic operation of a mobile structure optimized to extract energy from severe weather patterns. The system comprises a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure, a central service facility with a server running secure server software applications, and workstations running secure client software applications. The mobile structure communicates with the central service facility via a wireless physical medium, such as Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA) or Ultra High Frequency (UHF) radio. The server aggregates weather data from various sources, including weather satellites and the National Weather Service (NWS) Geographic Information System (GIS) computer servers. The system uses an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure. The algorithm adjusts points of sail, rudder rotation, openness of turbine gates, and ballast draft to optimize energy extraction. The system includes a Graphical User Interface (GUI) that allows remote humans to interact with and choose mission critical navigation plans.

The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a sheet metal material with an axial profiling and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The cage is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined and welded together in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring segments are preferably 120° segments punched out from a sheet metal strip and welded along their edge regions. The cage can be used for radial or axial bearings, including groove and angular ball bearings. The method for manufacturing the cage involves welding the ring segments together before forming the axial profiling.

The present methods and systems relate to processing and transmitting information to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network. They involve using global satellite positioning to obtain information related to a customer service location and routing travel between more than one such service location. A service technician visiting a customer service location is provided with a technician input device for receiving and transmitting information related to a disruption or interruption of service at the service location. The input device is configured and programmed to permit the service technician to access a technician server. The technician server is in communication with a global positioning satellite system for determining a set of coordinates associated with the input device. The technician server requests at least one set of coordinates associated with the customer service location and accesses the global satellite positioning system to obtain the set of coordinates for the customer service location. The coordinates are then obtained and one or more databases are updated with the coordinates. The coordinates may include at least one of a latitude and a longitude associated with the customer service location. In another aspect, the present methods and systems include generating directions for a service technician traveling from a first customer service location to at least a second customer service location. The technician server obtains at least one set of "from" coordinates associated with the first customer service location and at least one set of "to" coordinates associated with the second customer location. The "from" and "to" coordinates are transmitted to a mapping system, and directions are generated in the mapping system based on the "to" and the "from" coordinates. The mapping system can be operatively associated with the input device for generating travel directions based on the "from" and "to" coordinates. At least one of the sets of coordinates includes latitude and a longitude data.

The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging. The averaging is described by a matrix multiplication, where the output signals of the virtual sensor are used as inputs for independent control loops operating in parallel. The control loops have control algorithms transforming the virtual input signals into changed signals, which are then multiplied by a matrix to obtain control signals for the six coils. The algorithm used by the control system may overall be described as a matrix multiplication of the control signals, the modified signals, and the matrix describing the averaging over the output signals of the real sensors. The more inhomogeneous the compensation field is in case of homogeneous interference, and the more homogeneous the compensation field is in case of inhomogeneous interference, the smaller is the region around the feedback sensor having a good compensation effect. If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, this results in mutual interferences, which can be described by means of a feedback, or crosscoupling matrix C. The feedback system will not deliver optimal results, and an overcompensation, or an under compensation is only feasible for digital control systems, and also in this case for systems not operating in broadband. The position of the sensor would have to be fitted for all other systems, but this is not aimed for. Therefore, the matrix of the output signals of the real sensors is enlarged to a 6×1 matrix Ŝ, and the 6×1 matrix with the virtual sensor signals is calculated from the signals Ŝ expanded by the feedback part, obtained in this manner. Finally, control signals are calculated according to the following relation: O=L ·Ω( M ·( S−C·O )).

The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy. The method involves generating a resonance signal by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering through the excitation of at least one resonance site in the sample using laser irradiation. The method also includes furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner. The bioorthogonal reaction can be a Diels-Alder reaction or a Staudinger ligation. The at least one intrinsic structure of the sample can be coupled to a first reaction partner, which is then coupled to a further reaction partner. The method can also involve furnishing resonance sites for the structures of the non-resonant background of the sample and correlating a signal component of the resonance signal attributable to those resonance sites with a signal component attributable to intrinsic resonance sites of the sample. The method can be performed using a CARS microscope that includes a laser for generating a light beam of a first wavelength, a selection means for selecting a pump light beam and a Stokes light beam, and a detector for detecting the resonance signal.

The invention provides a system for comparing radiation therapy segmentations from different sources, converting them to volume models, and measuring missing and extra volume elements to assess quality. It offers visual and quantitative outputs, customizable metric methods, and can aid in training, evaluation, and quality assurance.

The invention accelerates floating point subtraction operations by initiating a subtraction procedure based on a subset of exponent argument signals before the full difference is known. This subset difference is used to begin subtracting fractions or parts thereof. If the full difference is different, the correct result is one of the operand fractions, which are already available. The apparatus includes units to calculate the subset difference, perform shifts and selections, and determine the final fraction result based on the full difference. The invention reduces the time required for floating point subtraction operations.

The present invention is a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients in a medical facility, aiming to reduce or eliminate mislabeling of specimen vials. The system uses unique machine-readable codes, such as barcodes, on identification (ID) means worn by patients and specimen-takers, on orders to obtain specimens, and on specimen containers. The method involves storing these codes in a relational manner in a computer storage, verifying that the patient ID and order are related to the same patient, and generating signals to acquire and process specimens. The system ensures that the correct specimen is placed in the correct container and sent to the lab for analysis, reducing errors and improving patient safety.

The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, incorporating GPS technology and voice recognition software. It is designed to be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor to pick up the user's voice clearly while rejecting external noise. The device provides distance and other information to the user via an audible output, following a verbal command. It can also accept verbal or other data input to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules and other golf player needs. The device may be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, hunting, and scuba diving, and may be expanded to include any portable application. It may also be provided with a communications method to facilitate various detailed functions, such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories viewed against an image of the subject golf course, display of clubs used, comparative display of any other player or players using the system, expert system advice based on data accrued during one or more recorded games, printing of results and scorecards.

The present invention provides a method for design rule checking in integrated circuits with mixed logic and memory regions. It creates customized design rules for different memory types by modifying standard logic rules with more liberal memory parameters. The method applies the correct set of rules to the appropriate regions of the mask pattern data, eliminating false errors and accurately reporting real errors. It categorizes errors based on the region where they occur, such as logic, BDSP SRAM, BLSP SRAM, DP SRAM, and ROM. The method can be applied to any mask pattern data, including those with no memory blocks or multiple types of memory blocks. It ensures that all regions fulfill the appropriate design rules, improving the efficiency and reliability of the design process.

The invention provides a method for controlled illumination of objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators, using thin substrate waveguides optically coupled to a coherent light source like a laser.
