The Children, Young People and Education Committee held a scrutiny session on the Children (Abolition of Defence of Reasonable Punishment) (Wales) Bill, with witnesses from the Association of Directors of Social Services (ADSS), the Association of Directors of Education Wales (ADEW), and the Welsh Local Government Association (WLGA). The witnesses discussed the importance of the Bill in bringing clarity to the law and protecting children's rights. They also addressed concerns about unintended consequences, such as increased referrals to social services and the potential criminalization of parents. The witnesses emphasized the need for awareness-raising campaigns and support for families to ensure a successful implementation of the Bill. The committee members asked questions about the implementation process, the impact on social services, and the importance of resources for a successful transition.

The Children, Young People and Education Committee held a scrutiny session on the Children (Abolition of Defence of Reasonable Punishment) (Wales) Bill, with witnesses from the Association of Directors of Social Services (ADSS), Association of Directors of Education Wales (ADEW), and Welsh Local Government Association (WLGA). The witnesses supported the Bill, stating that the current law is ineffective and unclear, and that physical punishment is harmful to children. They emphasized the need for clarity and consistency in the law, and expressed concern about the potential for the reasonable punishment defence to undermine child protection and permit arbitrary violence. The witnesses also discussed the importance of awareness raising and training for professionals, and the need for resources to support implementation. The committee heard that the Bill is not expected to have a significant impact on social services, but that there may be additional costs for training and awareness raising. The witnesses agreed that the Bill should not criminalize parents, and that support services should be available to help families. The committee also discussed the potential for unintended consequences, such as increased referrals to social services, and the need for clear guidance on the definition of corporal punishment. The witnesses emphasized the importance of proportionality and the need for a clear legal framework to protect children from harm.

The Children (Abolition of Defence of Reasonable Punishment) (Wales) Bill aims to remove the defence of reasonable punishment in Wales, aligning with the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child. The Bill's supporters, including the Welsh Local Government Association and the Association of Directors of Social Services, argue that it will bring clarity and remove ambiguity in child protection laws, while opponents express concerns about potential unintended consequences and resource implications.

The witnesses supported the Bill, stating that the current law is ineffective and unclear, and that physical punishment is harmful to children. They emphasized the need for clarity and awareness raising to ensure that children, parents, and professionals understand the changes. The witnesses discussed the potential impact on social services, education, and resources, and agreed that the Bill should be properly resourced to ensure its success. The committee thanked the witnesses for their attendance and engagement.

The witnesses supported the Bill, stating that the current law is ineffective and unclear, and that physical punishment is harmful to children. The discussion focused on the challenges in identifying schools in need of improvement and the new multi-agency approach to support them. The Minister acknowledged that the current system is not perfect and that more work needs to be done to address the persistent issues in secondary schools. The Minister also mentioned that the new approach is being evaluated by Cardiff Metropolitan University and Swansea University to see if it actually makes a difference.

The Minister for Education in Wales, Kirsty Williams AM, and Steve Davies, director of education, attended a committee meeting to discuss school improvement and raising standards in Welsh education. The meeting covered various topics, including the use of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) to evaluate the Welsh education system, the use of performance measures to drive improvement, the role of regional consortia in school improvement, and the impact of the pupil development grant on closing the attainment gap. The Minister expressed confidence in the progress made in Welsh education, but acknowledged that there is still more work to be done, particularly in closing the attainment gap between pupils eligible for free school meals and those who are not.

The Minister for Education in Wales, Kirsty Williams, and the director of education, Steve Davies, attended a committee meeting to discuss school improvement and raising standards. The Minister stated that the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) will publish a report on Welsh education on March 23, and she will make a statement to the Chamber on March 24. The Minister expressed her willingness to change the school categorization system if necessary, based on feedback from the OECD. The Minister also discussed the use of performance measures in schools, stating that the interim measures currently in place will continue for two to three years, and that the permanent measures will be aligned with the new curriculum. The Minister emphasized the importance of well-being in schools and expressed her desire to include it in the permanent performance measures. The Minister also discussed the PISA tests, stating that they are one of a range of tools used to assess the system's performance, and that the long-term targets of a score around 500 are part of the national mission. The Minister acknowledged that there is still more work to be done to close the attainment gap between pupils who are eligible for free school meals and those who are not.

They discussed various topics, including the use of the School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013, the national evaluation and improvement resource, the performance of secondary schools, the role of regional consortia, and the use of performance measures.

The Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams AM, and Steve Davies, director of education, attended a committee meeting to discuss school improvement and raising standards in Wales. The Minister stated that the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) will publish a report on Welsh education on 23 March, and she will make a statement to the Chamber on 24 March. The Minister expressed her expectation that the OECD report will provide an honest evaluation of the Welsh education system and its progress against the national mission. The Minister also discussed the use of performance measures in schools, stating that the interim measures currently in place will continue for two to three years, and that the permanent measures will be aligned to the new curriculum. The Minister emphasized the importance of looking at the performance of all children in a school, rather than just focusing on a narrow cohort, and that the new capped 9 and third-third-third systems allow for a more granular approach to evaluating school performance. The Minister also discussed the use of PISA as a tool for school improvement, stating that it is one of a range of tools that should be used, and that the long-term targets set in the national mission are still relevant and achievable. The Minister acknowledged that there is still work to be done to close the attainment gap between pupils who are eligible for free school meals and those who are not, and that more progress needs to be made in supporting learners from disadvantaged backgrounds.

The discussion focused on actions taken to improve school standards and raise attainment, with the Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams AM, and Steve Davies, director of education, providing evidence. They discussed the use of the School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013, the categorisation system, and the role of regional consortia. The Minister expressed confidence in the system's progress but acknowledged areas for improvement, such as closing the attainment gap for pupils eligible for free school meals. The committee members raised concerns about the lack of progress in some areas and the need for more evidence-based approaches. The Minister agreed that more work is needed to address these issues and committed to continuing to monitor and improve the system.

<summary>
Sydney Bristow, an agent of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), has returned after being presumed dead for two years. She is trying to piece together her lost memories and find out what happened to her during that time. Her father, Jack Bristow, is helping her, and they are working together to find answers. Sydney is also dealing with the fact that her former boyfriend, Michael Vaughn, has moved on and is now married to Lauren Reed, who is the new liaison between the CIA and the National Security Council (NSC). Meanwhile, the CIA is investigating a group called the Covenant, who are responsible for Sydney's disappearance and the death of an agent named Peter Klein. The Covenant has also released another agent, Sark, in exchange for a large sum of money that was left to him by his father, Andrian Lazarey, who was a descendant of the Romanov royal family. Sydney is determined to find out what happened to her and bring those responsible to justice.
</summary>

<summary>
The FBI investigates the murder of Franklin Curtis, an organic supermarket founder, who was found cooked in a compost pile. His mistress, Emma Billings, is also found dead, and it's revealed that she was his daughter from an affair with his wife's best friend. Kat Curtis, Franklin's daughter, and Charlie Rogan, a compost facility employee, are arrested for the murders. Booth and Brennan's partnership is evaluated by a psychologist, who suggests they have an emotional attachment.
</summary>

<summary>
Phoebe and Piper find Prue's apartment ransacked, with mirrors smashed and personal items missing. They suspect a demon is behind the attack. Prue is obsessed with finding the demon and neglects her personal life, including a date with Sean. Phoebe and Piper grow concerned about Prue's fixation. Prue sets a trap for the demon using her powers and the Book of Shadows. Cole gets caught in the trap and is injured. Phoebe and Piper realize that Prue's obsession has gone too far and they need to intervene. Prue apologizes to Cole for the trap and they make up. Prue goes on a date with Sean and has a good time. Phoebe and Cole grow closer, despite Prue's reservations about him. The sisters install an alarm system in the manor to protect themselves from future attacks.
</summary>

<summary>
The Source's death has created a power struggle in the underworld, leading to the appearance of Kurzon, who seeks to fill the void left by the Source's absence. Kurzon attacks the Charmed Ones, targeting Phoebe's past self, Little Phoebe, who has been brought into the present through a spell cast by Phoebe. Cole, now human, saves Little Phoebe from Kurzon, revealing his demonic powers to the Charmed Ones. Phoebe's future self, Old Phoebe, appears and slaps Cole, revealing a grudge she holds against him. Phoebe struggles to get answers from Old Phoebe about her future with Cole, but Old Phoebe refuses to reveal anything that could change the course of history. Kurzon attacks the manor again, targeting Cole, and Old Phoebe sacrifices herself to save him. Phoebe, Piper, and Paige vanquish Kurzon, and Old Phoebe and Little Phoebe disappear, their purpose fulfilled. Phoebe and Cole decide to move forward with their wedding plans, despite Phoebe's lingering doubts.
</summary>

<summary>
Terri, feeling self-conscious about her weight, decides not to attend the school dance. Her friends Ashley and Paige convince her to go, helping her get ready and boosting her confidence. At the dance, Terri gets drunk and makes a fool of herself, embarrassing herself and her friends. Meanwhile, Emma, who was also hesitant to attend the dance, ends up having a good time with a new student named Sean. Toby and JT, who skipped the dance, get caught looking at inappropriate websites by Toby's dad and his girlfriend. The next day, Terri is embarrassed about her behavior at the dance and feels humiliated when Spinner, who she had a crush on, starts using Paige's notes instead of hers.
</summary>

<summary>Ross and Rachel discover they're still married and try to get an annulment, but the judge refuses and they must file for divorce instead. Joey becomes obsessed with a Porsche and pretends to own it, while Phoebe babysits triplets alone and causes chaos in Monica's apartment. Ross and Rachel finally admit their mistakes and decide to divorce amicably.</summary>

Frasier realizes he has feelings for Kate and tries to stop her from moving to Chicago, but she's already with another man. He ends up going on a disastrous date with another woman instead. Meanwhile, Niles, Daphne, Martin, and Eddie are watching movies at Frasier's apartment. Frasier eventually finds Kate at the airport and they have a heart-to-heart conversation, but they realize they're not compatible and part ways.

Frasier and Niles become obsessed with gaining access to the exclusive gold level of a spa they've discovered, La Porte D'Argent. They try various methods to gain entry, including bribing a hacker and trying to charm the receptionist, but to no avail. Roz, who knows Senator Ogden, offers to help them gain access, but when she meets with him at Cafe Nervosa, he has a heart attack and she has to perform CPR on him again. Meanwhile, Martin and Daphne bond over their shared love of the TV show "Rockford Files," with Martin initially being upset that Daphne sees him as more like Rockford's cranky father than the suave private investigator himself.
Lorelai visits her mother to ask for her opinion on her wedding veil, but Emily dismisses her and suggests a tiara instead. Lorelai feels hurt by her mother's lack of interest in her wedding plans.

<summary>
Casey plans a bonding event for the Zeta Beta Zeta (ZBZ) pledges, but Rebecca disrupts it by telling ghost stories and claiming the house is haunted by a former pledge, Virginia Horton, who died by suicide after losing the presidency to Trudy Henderson. Meanwhile, at the Omega Chi house, Evan and Calvin bond while trying to catch a mouse during a power outage. At the Kappa Tau (KT) house, Cappie meets Destiny, a mysterious woman who reveals she had a crush on him at summer camp ten years ago. Rusty tries to warn Cappie about Destiny's true intentions, but Cappie is smitten. Back at the ZBZ house, the girls hold a séance to communicate with Virginia, who they believe is trying to tell them something. Casey leads an impromptu election to determine the presidency between Virginia and Trudy, with Virginia winning unanimously. The power returns, and the girls celebrate with ice cream. At the KT house, Cappie kisses Destiny, but she is disappointed and leaves. Cappie receives a text message from Heath, and Beaver brings in a dog named Timmy.</summary>

George's wife, Callie, finds out about his affair with Izzie and confronts her in the cafeteria, but ultimately decides not to fight. Meredith and Derek discuss their relationship and decide to continue as they are, but Derek hints that he may move on if Meredith doesn't commit to him. Izzie is shunned by her friends and colleagues after her affair with George is revealed, and she is left alone to cry in her apartment.

Ty returns to Heartland and helps Amy find a missing horse. Jade struggles with her new role as a ranch hand but eventually bonds with a horse named Dash. Ty discovers that Bob, the reserve manager, has been involved with poachers and confronts him. Ty decides to leave the reserve and return to work at Heartland.

<TITLE: The Year 2030>
Narrator: Kids, when you're single, you're looking for happily ever after, but only one story can end that way. This is one of those stories, starting with a shirt.
<THE YEAR 2005>
Ted finds an old shirt he likes and decides to wear it, which leads to a conversation about second impressions and past relationships.
His friends suggest he reconnect with Natalie, a girl he dated in the past, and he decides to call her.
Natalie hangs up on him, but he shows up at her door with a sock monkey, apologizing for how he ended their relationship in the past.
They start dating again, but Ted realizes he doesn't have feelings for her and decides to break up with her.
He takes her to dinner on her birthday to do the mature thing, but she gets upset when he tells her he doesn't think she's the one for him.
She kicks him and he ends up bruised and bleeding, realizing there's no good way to break up with someone.
Natalie gets married with three children a year later, showing that sometimes things happen for a reason.
Narrator: Is that all you're taking away from this story?

<summary>Raj's parents arrange a date for him with Lalita Gupta, an old acquaintance who has lost weight. Raj, nervous about meeting her, gets drunk and makes a poor impression. Sheldon, who is captivated by Lalita's resemblance to a character from an Indian folk tale, goes on a date with her instead. Raj's parents are upset about the failed arranged marriage and suspect Raj has a drinking problem. Sheldon, feeling guilty, apologizes to Raj but also points out that Lalita found Raj boring. Raj's parents scold him for getting drunk and threaten an intervention. Sheldon decides not to see Lalita again, as he already has a dentist. Leonard wonders who will tell Raj's parents they won't have grandchildren. Penny admits to spiking Sheldon's drinks to see if alcohol affects his behavior.</summary>

<summary>Sheldon secretly spends 20 minutes each day in a basement room, where he's been testing wormhole generators to explore parallel universes. Leonard feels threatened by Penny's classmate, Cole, who has an English accent. Howard and Raj discover Sheldon's secret and feel guilty for invading his privacy. Penny tells Leonard she loves him, but he's still insecure about Cole. Alex, Leonard's assistant, flirts with him via text.</summary>

Sheldon Cooper announces the final episode of his flag-themed web series, "Fun with Flags," due to his busy schedule. He reflects on the show's highlights and shares a personal message. Meanwhile, Leonard, Howard, and Raj clean out the office of a deceased professor, Roger Abbott, and find his food diary instead of any significant research. Penny tries to help Bernadette improve her image at work, as her colleagues find her intimidating. Sheldon decides to revive "Fun with Flags" after receiving positive feedback from a viewer.

<summary>Caroline struggles to cope with her mother's death, planning to flip her humanity switch to avoid feeling the pain. Elena tries to convince her not to, but Caroline snaps her neck. Stefan finds Elena's body and Caroline missing. Bonnie returns from the 1903 prison world with a video of Damon's mother.</summary>

Veronica Mars, a private investigator, is hired to find a missing monkey, Twenty-five, from Hearst College. She infiltrates a group called People for Humane Animal Treatment (PHAT) to find leads on the monkey's whereabouts. Meanwhile, her friend Mac starts dating Bronson Pope, the president of PHAT, and Veronica becomes suspicious of his involvement in the monkey's disappearance. Veronica discovers that Gil Thomas, one of the researchers at the college, had been taking care of Twenty-five on the weekends and had poured green tea leaves into the hard drive to destroy the research data. Veronica returns the research money to Gil and Mac, and Veronica starts dating Piz, a radio DJ at the college.

Pam and Charlie announce their engagement, and Pam wants to get married at the Forrester estate. Brooke tells Ridge about her encounter with Bill at the restaurant, and Ridge is upset that Bill keeps pursuing Brooke. Brooke assures Ridge that she only loves him and that Bill can't come between them. Ridge is still determined to put an end to Bill's advances.
</summary>

<summary>Ridge is alive and returns to Puerto Vista with Brooke, Massimo, and Nick. Brooke and Ridge reunite with Stephanie, who apologizes for her past behavior and promises to support their relationship. Amber is kicked out of Deacon's house by Bridget, who believes it's best for Eric. Amber confides in Oscar about her struggles and he encourages her to stay at Forrester Creations. Ridge, Stephanie, Massimo, and Brooke catch up and discuss their plans for the future. Ridge expresses his desire to start a family with Brooke.</summary>

<summary>
Rick disapproves of Caroline and Ridge's latest design, while Maya hints at their inappropriate behavior. Hope confronts Deacon and Quinn about their relationship, leading to a heated argument. Deacon questions Quinn's intentions, and she tries to reassure him. Wyatt advises Hope to focus on their own future instead of their parents' actions. Maya tells Rick she saw Caroline and Ridge in an intimate embrace, but he dismisses her concerns. Ridge and Caroline say their goodbyes, hinting at the end of their professional partnership. Quinn seduces Deacon to keep him from leaving. </summary>

Bill Spencer is out of the hospital and wants to change his ways, but Ridge Forrester is skeptical. Brooke Logan believes in Bill's desire to change and repair his relationships, but Eric Forrester is wary. Pam Douglas and Quinn Fuller argue over a portrait of Stephanie Forrester, leading Pam to call off her wedding at Eric's house. Ridge visits Bill in the hospital and accuses him of still pursuing Brooke. Bill denies this and claims he wants to be a better person. Ridge and Bill argue about their respective track records with Brooke.

<summary>Thomas is determined to make a splash with his men's line, despite Hope's successful debut. Taylor is worried about Thomas' plans, while Whip encourages him to create a big spectacle. Thomas introduces his line, thanking Brooke for her input. Oliver confesses his feelings to Hope, hoping to rekindle their relationship. Thomas and Brooke take the stage together, causing a surprised reaction from the audience.</summary>

<summary>Brooke and Ridge discuss Thomas' disappearance, with Ridge expressing concern and Brooke trying to downplay the situation. Hope confesses to Ridge that she killed Thomas, but Brooke convinces her to keep quiet due to the lack of evidence and the potential consequences. Ridge and Steffy discuss Thomas' recent behavior and Ridge blames himself for not being there for his son. Hope struggles with guilt and the decision to confess, while Thomas, who is alive, overhears her. Hope is shocked and relieved to find Thomas alive.</summary>

<summary>
Brooke waits with Stephanie, who is coughing and struggling to speak. Hope and Eric discuss a video tribute to Stephanie, with Eric unsure if it's too upsetting to show her now. Katie confides in Taylor about her postpartum depression and fear of not being a good mother to Will. Thorne and Felicia have a heartfelt conversation about their relationship. Stephanie asks Brooke to take off her wedding ring and give it to her, revealing she wants Brooke to have it. Taylor encourages Katie to hold Will, reassuring her that her struggles aren't her fault. Brooke reads Stephanie a story, comparing it to their own relationship. Will is brought to Katie, who is hesitant to hold him but eventually does. Pam and Eric share emotional goodbyes with Stephanie. Brooke sings Stephanie to sleep, crying as she does so.</summary>

<summary>Stephanie is shot and in the hospital; Eric believes Donna is responsible based on Stephanie's statement, but Donna denies it; Ridge and Brooke argue about whether a Logan is responsible; Eric returns home to find Pam, who has come to take care of him; Stephanie has hallucinations and accuses Donna again; Eric asks Stephanie if she saw Donna pull the trigger, but she's sedated; Donna confronts Stephanie in her hospital room, denying involvement and warning her to stop accusing her.</summary>

<Taylor is happy to have Phoebe home, but Phoebe is still hurt by Taylor's relationship with Rick. Brooke wants Rick to attend her wedding, but he refuses. Ridge visits Taylor and Phoebe, and Taylor asks him to maintain a friendly relationship with her and the kids for their sake. Brooke begs Rick to support her wedding, and he eventually agrees.>

Brooke wants Ridge to accept Jack, her biological son with Nick, into their lives, but Ridge is worried about the complications this could cause. Brooke and Ridge both confide in Ashley about the situation, causing tension between them. Brooke and Nick decide that Brooke should not see Jack again to avoid further complications.

<summary>
Brooke is surprised and flattered by Thorne's kiss, but is hesitant to pursue anything due to her relationship with Ridge and their son R.J. Thorne, however, is determined to win Brooke back, believing Ridge will only hurt her again. Ridge is planning a surprise for Brooke to win her back, while Quinn believes Brooke and Ridge will eventually reunite. Nicole and Maya discuss the possibility of Brooke and Thorne getting back together, which could cause tension between Ridge and Thorne. Ridge confides in Quinn about Thorne knowing about their kiss and how it's affecting Brooke. Thorne tells Brooke that Ridge will only hurt her again and that she should marry him instead. Brooke is torn between her feelings for Ridge and Thorne's declaration.
</summary>

Nicole begs Brady to help her keep Mia from finding out about her lie, but he refuses and tells Mia the truth. Nicole is heartbroken and blames Brady for ruining her chance at happiness. Meanwhile, Chloe struggles with her feelings for Daniel and Lucas, and Daniel tries to convince her to call off the engagement. Chelsea is hesitant to go to Lucas and Chloe's engagement party alone, but Max offers to go with her. John decides to go through with hypnosis to try and regain his memories, much to Marlena's relief. Nicole manages to convince Mia to give her the baby, but Mia insists on meeting Nicole's fiancé first.

<summary>
Adrienne tells Jennifer about Abigail and EJ's meetings. Abigail confirms to Jennifer that she's been seeing EJ, who helped her get a message from her late father. EJ tells Sami about his role in keeping Abigail quiet about Nick's texts. Gabi thanks EJ with churros, but he's distracted by Abigail's call about Jennifer knowing about them. Daniel's computer files are missing, and he suspects Nicole's involvement. Eric's test results are also missing. Anne files a complaint against Daniel for pushing her. Kate and Sami strategize about Nick's situation.
</summary>

Stefano DiMera is lured to the bank by a fake employee, where he is confronted by Hope and Bo about his shared safe deposit box with Maggie. Meanwhile, Melanie struggles with her feelings for Chad while dealing with her father's impending departure.

<summary>
Rex and Mimi argue about her helping Belle and Shawn, leading Mimi to confess she had an abortion without telling Rex. Shawn and Belle struggle with how to tell Philip about their relationship as he leaves for war. Kate and Eugenia plot to sabotage Sami's wedding. Sami, under the influence of a drug, confesses her secrets to an unconscious Brandon. John struggles with his addiction and Kate's help. Belle considers emailing Philip about their marriage.
</summary>

EJ and Abigail continue their affair, while Sami and Nick have a tense encounter. JJ seeks advice from Kayla about forgiveness, and Theresa tries to buy gift cards using Abigail's name. Daniel and Nicole stake out Chyka's hideout, while Brady leaves the AA program and runs into Jennifer.

<summary>Carly is held captive by Vivian in a basement, who plans to harm Melanie at her wedding. Victor assures Hope that Vivian won't cause any trouble, but Carly sends a distress signal to Bo. Melanie is nervous about her wedding, and Nathan is going on a trip with Stephanie after the ceremony. Philip is worried about the wedding, and Stefano arrives to help. Maggie is struggling with her anniversary, and Daniel is happy about Chloe's pregnancy. Vivian reveals to Carly that she has a plan to kill Melanie, and Carly is determined to stop her.</summary>

Max and Abby reconnect and Max confesses he had a crush on Abby in the past. Chelsea is upset after an argument with her father and Nick tries to comfort her, but she rejects him. Billie reassures Chelsea that her father will come around and that Hope believes in her. Bo is still angry with Chelsea and doesn't want to give her another chance.

Lexie and Tek continue their affair, while Abe struggles with his vision loss. John threatens Alex, who remains determined to marry Marlena. Mimi plans to confess to Shawn that he is Claire's father. Philip and Belle share a moment of honesty about their feelings.

Marlena and John argue about Tony's involvement in their lives, with John accusing Tony of manipulating Marlena and Marlena defending Tony's intentions. Rex discovers that Professor Putnam is not who he seems and has a connection to Rex and Cassie's creation. Kate confesses her past to Roman, revealing that she used to sell her services for money. Belle and Shawn-D have a playful argument about Belle's wild side, leading to a food fight. John and Marlena dance together, with Marlena trying to reassure John of her commitment to their marriage.

Chelsea is rushed to the hospital after fainting at home, and Kate and Nick are by her side. Ava continues to hold Bo, Hope, Kayla, and Steve hostage, revealing her plan to keep Kayla's baby as her own. E.J. and Sami argue over his decision to represent Nicole in her divorce case, with Sami threatening to tell the immigration officer about E.J.'s past if he doesn't drop the case.

Nicole suspects EJ and Stefano of kidnapping and mind-controlling Rafe, and plans to confront EJ. Theo and Ciara are found safe, and Rafe is hailed as a hero. EJ decides to divorce Nicole to be with Taylor, but Taylor is conflicted about betraying her sister. Chad agrees to work for Stefano at DiMera Enterprises this summer.

<summary>
Jack returns to Salem, surprising Jennifer and Abby; Bo and Billie investigate a lead on Georgia's whereabouts; Marlena and Roman are revealed to be alive; Hope apologizes to Jennifer for her actions; Jack becomes jealous of Patrick's closeness with Jennifer; Bo and Billie discover a clue in an abandoned house, leading to an ambush.
</summary>

<summary>
Sonny discovers that Deimos has tracked down Brady and Nicole in Manitoba, Canada, and is on his way to help them. Abigail and Gabi have a heated conversation about Chad and their feelings for him. Tripp struggles to accept Steve as his father due to Ava's death. Brady and Nicole are held hostage by a man working for Deimos, who shoots Brady. Gabi and Eli grow closer, and Steve thanks Kayla for her efforts in trying to bring Tripp into their family. Jade tries to convince Tripp to forgive Steve, but he remains unconvinced. Nicole is held captive by Xander, who has been working with Deimos all along.</summary>

<summary>Roman is trying to track down Kate, who is avoiding him. John and Marlena are at the Dimera mansion, where a party hosted by Cassie ended in an attempt to poison Shawn. Chaz is in custody, but Vin Ramsell is still at large. Bo and Hope are determined to find Ramsell and bring him to justice. Sami and Lucas have a heated argument on Sami's fire escape.</summary>

Brady presents Kristen with adoption papers as a wedding gift, surprising her with the news that they can have a child together. Meanwhile, John decides to seduce Kristen before Brady can marry her, while Eric refuses to attend the wedding due to his conflicted feelings about his mother and Kristen.

Nick has been shot and is in critical condition. Julie finds him and calls for an ambulance. Lucas is looking for Allie and Jordan, who were supposed to be together. Will receives news about Nick's shooting from Sonny. Gabi and Kate are also present when they hear about the shooting. Sami and EJ are at home discussing their wedding plans, unaware of the shooting. Rafe is called to the scene and arrives with the ambulance. The identity of the shooter is not yet known.

<summary>
Sami struggles to accept her mother's death and blames John and Kate for her murder. Marlena's spirit communicates through Celeste, urging John not to bury her. Shawn is held captive by Jan, who refuses to let him go. Nicole tries to bail out her accomplice, Crystal, to prevent her from talking. Belle delivers a eulogy for her mother at her funeral, while Sami has a private moment with her mother's coffin. Hope expresses concern for Shawn's whereabouts. Sami hears her mother's voice calling out to her from the coffin.
</summary>

Nick discovers Max altered his grant proposal without his knowledge, causing tension between them. Philip is suspected of involvement in a warehouse fire, which John believes was Philip's doing. Max confronts Dean Robbins about his theories, causing a scene. Lucas and Sami argue about trust, and Sami offers to keep Lucas' secrets.

<summary>
Chloe and Daniel are about to get married again, but Chloe is hesitant due to her recent health scare. Melanie, Daniel's daughter, supports the wedding but is concerned about Chloe's behavior. Meanwhile, Kate and Stefano discuss Madeline's safe deposit box, and Will talks to Stefano about moving out of the DiMera mansion. Jennifer and her family are making Alice's favorite cookies, and Mike is on his way to Salem to see Alice. Carly shows up at the wedding, determined to speak her mind.
</summary>

Hope decides to go away with Aiden to the Green Mountain Lodge to figure out their relationship, while Ciara gets a volunteer position at Shady Hills. Abigail is worried about being sent to a state asylum, and Chad is planning to break her out. Rafe is supportive of Hope's trip with Aiden, hoping it will help her realize her mistake.

Abe agrees to officiate Sami and EJ's wedding, surprising them both. Sami asks Abigail to be her maid of honor and read at the ceremony. Paige's mother, Eve, arrives in Salem and meets JJ, who is nervous about her finding out about his criminal record. Jordan and Rafe are still not talking, and Kate tries to convince Jordan to reach out to him. Abigail visits the DiMera mansion to prepare for the wedding, and EJ is there. Jennifer is excited to meet Eve and thinks she and Paige have a lot in common. JJ is worried about Eve's reaction to his past, but Jennifer reassures him. Paige helps Eve pick out an outfit for dinner with the Deverauxs, and Eve is shocked to learn that JJ is a Deveraux.

<summary>Kate visits Victor to discuss Nicole's new job at Dimera and her potential involvement with Xander. Hope searches for Ted and suspects he might be with Nicole. Brady tries to convince Nicole to work for him instead of Stefan, but she declines. Nicole reveals she has a scar from the fire but refuses to show it to Sami. Ted tries to convince Xander not to kill him by appealing to his desire to win Sarah's heart. Xander decides to let Ted live for now. Kate finds something in Nicole's room that she thinks Victor will find interesting. Sami and Lucas discuss Nicole's behavior and her potential secret. Eric is about to marry Rex and Sarah, but Sarah wants to talk to him first.</summary>

<summary>Hope visits Marlena to ask her to send Ben back to Shady Hills, but Marlena refuses, believing Ben is innocent. Ben visits Ciara, claiming he didn't set the fire, but Tripp is skeptical. Chad confides in Marlena about his struggles with Abigail's pregnancy. Abigail argues with Stefan about his role in the baby's life. Lani and Eli have a tense conversation about their past. Gabi and JJ discuss their friendship, and Gabi considers confessing her actions.</summary>

<summary>
Sami disrupts Marlena and John's wedding to warn them about Kristen's plan to kill Marlena after she's pronounced married. Kristen appears, holding a gun, and confirms Sami's fears. She reveals that she survived the fall from the tower and has returned to seek revenge on Marlena. Kristen taunts Sami by revealing that EJ is alive and offering to take her to him if she kills John. Sami struggles with the decision, torn between her love for her mother and her desire to see EJ again. Meanwhile, Will regains more of his memories, including his wedding to Sonny and the birth of their daughter. He decides to tell his family about his regained memories.
</summary>

Jennifer tells JJ she hopes he's not putting Paige in danger by revealing his undercover status to Kyle. Eve tells Kyle that JJ is working for the DEA and warns him about Paige's involvement. Marlena advises Will to give Sonny time and space. Paul and John bond over baseball memories. Abigail confesses her love for Chad and tells him the baby is his. Adrienne and Lucas go on a late-night adventure together.

<summary>Will is worried about his grandmother Kate, who is still in surgery after being shot. Sonny offers to read to Arianna so Will can wait for news. Vivian visits Eve, who wants to help Stefan at Dimera Enterprises. Eve reveals she was fired by Jack and wants revenge. Jack and Jennifer search for Dr. Rolf, who has gone missing. Brady struggles with his feelings for Kristen, who tries to seduce him. Sarah confesses her love for Eric but accepts that they can't be together. Nicole and Eric finally decide to be together now that Sarah understands their relationship. Xander tells Sarah he knows she's pregnant.</summary>

Orpheus, the mastermind behind the recent chaos in Salem, is finally captured and taken into custody. However, he manages to grab a gun and takes Dr. Marlena Evans hostage, leading to a tense standoff with the police. Meanwhile, JJ is rushed to the hospital after being shot by Orpheus, and his family and friends gather to support him as he fights for his life.

Eve Donovan is revealed to be the new CEO of Basic Black, much to the dismay of Victor and Brady Kiriakis. Brady is demoted from his position as CEO of Titan and tasked with removing Eve from the company. Gabi is offered a job by Kate Roberts to fold her business, Gabi Chic, into Countess W, but she is hesitant due to her history with Chad DiMera. Abigail Deveraux is hired as the new head of PR at Dimera Enterprises, much to Gabi's surprise. Brady believes he has found out who killed Deimos Kiriakis and calls the police to his home.

Paul breaks up with Will, who then goes to tell Sonny but finds out he's left town. Paul decides to move back to San Francisco for a chance to walk again, while Will tries to find Sonny. Claire and Ben's plan to break up Tripp and Ciara backfires when Ciara finds out the truth. Ciara breaks up with Tripp, who then turns to Claire for comfort. Abe and Valerie argue about her job offer in D.C., with Abe feeling selfish for not wanting her to take it.

Abe goes on a date with Valerie, but Theo suspects she's hiding something. Claire and Theo plan to investigate Valerie. Chad and Gabi decide to remain friends after a brief romantic moment. Abigail considers revealing herself to Chad and Thomas.

Rafe receives news that he might be reinstated in the FBI, which could help him find Sydney. Carly confesses to Daniel that she killed Lawrence. Vivian locks Carly in a room with limited oxygen, planning to kill her. Philip and Nathan get into a fight at the police station.

Luke is recovering in the hospital after his heart attack, and Tracy is worried about him. Sonny has been arrested in New York for assault, and Jason is trying to find out where he's being held. Diane has been nominated for "Litigator of the Year" and is looking for the perfect dress to wear to the awards dinner. Alexis is also looking for a dress for the same event, and she runs into Ric and Skye in his office. Nikolas goes for a walk with Lulu and Spencer, and they run into Emily, who is still appearing to Nikolas.

Sonny accidentally shoots his son Dante, who is revealed to be an undercover cop and Sonny's long-lost son. Olivia, Dante's mother, blames Sonny for not telling her about his criminal activities, which led to Dante's undercover assignment.

Jason is approached by Claudia Zacchara, who offers a truce between their families in exchange for information on her brother Johnny's whereabouts. Sonny is still holding Johnny captive, refusing to release him until his son Michael is found. Meanwhile, Sam is being held captive by Diego Alcazar, who plans to use her as bait to lure Sonny into a trap.

<summary>
Johnny Zacchara is trying to disrupt Sonny Corinthos' organization without killing anyone, which is causing tension between him and Lucky Spencer. Sonny is trying to bond with his son Dante Falconeri, who is testifying against him in his upcoming murder trial. Dante is also trying to protect his younger brother Michael Corinthos from being forced to testify. Michael is struggling with the guilt of killing Claudia Zacchara and the fact that his father is taking the blame for it. Carly Jacks is determined to lie in court to protect Michael and Sonny. Jason Morgan is trying to find Franco, who is taunting him with cryptic messages. Elizabeth Webber is trying to decide whether to tell Lucky or Nikolas Cassadine that their child could be hers. Lucky is trying to protect his brother Ethan Lovett from getting caught up in the mob war between Sonny and Johnny. Nikolas is trying to convince Elizabeth to let him set up a trust for her baby. Dante is trying to get Michael to tell him the truth about what happened to Claudia.
</summary>

Todd Manning, Starr's father, attempts to kill Sonny Corinthos for causing the car accident that killed Cole and Hope, but is stopped by his daughter and arrested by John McBain. Starr blames Sonny for the accident and plans to testify against him in court. Meanwhile, Johnny Zacchara tries to seduce Connie Falconeri to set up Sonny and get revenge.

<summary>
Sonny and Carly struggle with Morgan's death, while Sonny seeks help from Curtis to find Olivia Jerome, who is still at large. Jason and Sam are reunited with their newborn daughter, Scout, and Jason helps disarm the bomb in the hospital. Olivia takes Alexis hostage and forces Julian to choose between his love for her and his sister's life. Jordan is injured and must take a leave of absence, while Finn decides to take a leave of absence to focus on his addiction. Carly discovers that Olivia was the one who killed Morgan and vows to make her pay.</summary>

<summary>
Michael is determined to protect Abby from her attacker, Brandon, who is out on bail. Dante tries to reassure Abby that the justice system will work in her favor, but Michael is skeptical. Abby decides not to press charges against Brandon, fearing that a trial would put Michael in danger. Luke struggles with guilt over hitting Jake with his car, while Elizabeth blames herself for not watching her son. Sonny and Brenda discuss the accident and the pain it has caused everyone involved. Suzanne reveals to Theo that their grandson is alive and well, and they decide to raise him together. Patrick and Robin enjoy a family dinner with Emma, while Shawn introduces himself to Josslyn as her new bodyguard. Suzanne and Theo plan to keep Brenda in the dark about their grandson's existence. Elizabeth visits Luke and they both express their grief and guilt over Jake's death.</summary>

<summary>
Alexis visits Sam and Jason, expressing her concerns about Jason's ability to protect a child given his past losses. Jason is conflicted about the possibility of having another child with Sam. Carly hires Shawn to protect Josslyn, but Jax is determined to use Shawn's past to gain full custody of their daughter. Brenda struggles with connecting with Alec and feels that Sonny is keeping secrets from her. Sonny confides in Jason about his doubts regarding Brenda's safety and their relationship. Kristina admits to Michael that she was prescribed hydrocodone by Lisa Niles and is now addicted. Robin is held captive by Lisa in the basement of the hospital, who plans to frame Patrick for her murder. </summary>

<summary>
Jason believes Nikolas faked his death to escape from Hayden, who may have been trying to frame Jason. Lucas was attacked at the hospital, and Jordan is investigating. Franco offers to help Elizabeth take down Hayden. Nathan confesses to Maxie that he shot a man in a drunken rage years ago. Hayden's mother, Naomi, arrives in Port Charles. Monica asks Finn to take a drug test. Jason goes on the run after learning of a warrant for his arrest. Sam and Jason play dominoes and drink tequila at Sonny's safe house. Maxie leaves Nathan after learning about his past.</summary>

Nikolas decides to give his relationship with Rebecca another chance, while Michael goes to a bar and runs into Johnny Zacchara. Sonny warns Jason about Johnny's disrespectful behavior towards Olivia, and Claudia asks Johnny to help her get rid of Jason.

Maxie's condition worsens, and Georgie regains consciousness, determined to see her sister before it's too late. Sonny confronts Reese about her lies and gives her an ultimatum: be honest with him or leave.

<summary>
- Patrick and Robin take care of Jake, Robin's nephew, while Elizabeth goes out.
- Patrick struggles with changing Jake's diaper and feeding him.
- Robin and Patrick argue about their future as parents.
- Elizabeth returns and reveals that Robin set up the situation to test Patrick.
- Johnny and Maxie are stuck in an elevator together.
- Maxie tries to convince Johnny to leave Lulu for her own good.
- Lulu and Maxie argue about Lulu's relationship with Johnny.
- Lulu tells Maxie that she is not fragile like her mother, Laura.
- Johnny is arrested for assaulting Scott Baldwin.
- Kate tells Sonny that there has been a change in their wedding plans.
</summary>

<summary>
Tracy and Luke plan to find Jerry Jacks to get the cure for Luke's polonium 210 poisoning; Lulu reveals Stavros ordered Nikolas' shooting to punish her; Nikolas forgives Lulu; Laura and Nikolas are excited about Lulu's baby girl; Nikolas and Laura suspect Luke is hiding something; Elizabeth finds out AJ slept with Carly; Nikolas deletes Tracy's message to Elizabeth; Shawn agrees to quit working for Sonny to stay with Alexis; Carly lets Morgan stay at the boathouse with Kiki, but warns Franco and Ava she's not done with them.
</summary>

<summary>
Elizabeth tells Lucky about Patrick's HIV exposure, Lucky feels guilty about Manny's death, Sam and Jason are stuck in an elevator together, Sonny argues with Emily and Carly about his mother's role in his abuse, Nikolas and Emily take John for a walk, Patrick starts HIV medication, Lucky confesses to Elizabeth about Manny's death, Sam studies for her GED with Jason's help, Sonny and Carly discuss his mother's abuse, Nikolas finds John in danger.
</summary>

<summary>
Sam is worried about her malaria test results and asks Elizabeth not to tell Jason about her pregnancy. Kevin and Laura's malaria test results come back negative. Julian offers to help Alexis with her bar hearing in exchange for his freedom, but she refuses. Ava visits Nikolas' grave and drinks to his memory. Kristina and Aaron have a heart-to-heart about their relationship. Jordan gives André a key to her apartment. Laura tells Kevin that Nikolas died a hero. Sam and Elizabeth go to the hospital together to get Sam's test results.
</summary>

Lucky confesses to Elizabeth that he's been having an affair with Maxie, leading to a heated argument. Elizabeth, heartbroken, turns to Jason for comfort, and they end up spending the night together. Meanwhile, Ric reveals to Sonny that he slept with Sam to get back at Jason, and Sonny advises Ric to focus on his family instead of his grudge against Jason. Alexis confides in Sonny about her marital issues, and Sonny encourages her to be honest with Ric about her needs.

Carly is nervous about her wedding day, worried about her son Michael not attending and the possibility of Morgan causing trouble. Sonny is trying to help Morgan deal with his bipolar disorder and convince him to attend the wedding. Michael is struggling with forgiving Sonny for killing his father and is considering attending the wedding to support his mother. Nikolas and Hayden are spending the day together, and Nikolas is considering taking time off work to spend more time with her.

Sonny Corinthos has been shot and is in critical condition, with his wedding to Carly Corinthos in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Nikolas Cassadine and Hayden Barnes continue to dance around the truth about Jake's identity, and Anna Devane and Sloane Henry's relationship becomes strained due to Sloane's involvement in the mayoral election tampering.

Franco is released from prison due to his tumor affecting his ability to tell right from wrong. Sonny is found by Olivia and his sons after attempting suicide, and they convince him to return home. Kiki learns that Franco is her father and goes to find him. Morgan confesses to Sonny that he feels responsible for Connie's death. Britt gives birth to her baby, and Sabrina delivers him. Sonny is determined not to feel better.

Jerry Jacks, the mastermind behind the pathogen outbreak in Port Charles, has taken Alexis Davis hostage and plans to escape with her on his boat. Meanwhile, Dante Falconeri and Lulu Spencer are trying to defuse a bomb attached to the antiserum that can cure the pathogen, while Sonny Corinthos and Shawn Butler are attempting to rescue Alexis. Tracy Quartermaine has stolen the only dose of the antiserum to give to her father, Edward Quartermaine, but Monica Quartermaine is determined to find it and use it to save patients at the hospital.

<summary>Paul uses his connection with Mayor Lomax to get Dillon's movie production back on track; Ava is desperate to find the flash drive that could incriminate her for Connie's murder; Morgan is determined to find and kill Julian for shooting his father, Sonny; Michael and Carly search for Morgan to stop him before he does something irreparable; Patrick confesses his love for Sam and asks her to marry him; Alexis and Julian hide out at a cabin while Morgan searches for Julian; Sonny worries about Morgan's safety and stability.</summary>

Sonny's wedding to Kate is interrupted when she announces she can't marry him because she's already married to someone else. Meanwhile, Jason discovers that Sam's baby is alive and living with Téa in Llanview. Kristina is kidnapped by Joe Scully Jr., who plans to use her to get revenge on Sonny.

Sonny agrees to marry Claudia Zacchara to take over the Zacchara organization, much to Johnny's dismay. Jason is arrested for his role in the Pier 23 warehouse fire and the shooting of three men. Elizabeth and her sons arrive at a cabin, but their cell phones don't work and they soon realize the Russians are outside.

Franco, an artist obsessed with Jason, lured him to his studio. Carly and Sonny argued about how to handle Michael's involvement in Claudia's death. Rebecca, hit by Nikolas' car, told Ethan she wanted to expose Nikolas' secrets. Olivia and Johnny discussed their relationship, with Johnny deciding to stay with Olivia despite her feelings for Sonny. Sam worried about Jason's safety as he confronted Franco. Maxie tried to convince Sam to ask Jason to help her with Franco for a "Crimson" photo shoot.

Franco confesses to killing his mother, Heather, and seeks help from Dr. Kevin Collins. Meanwhile, Lulu blames Dante for their loss of custody of their daughter, and Spinelli decides to move to Portland with his girlfriend and daughter, much to Maxie's dismay.
Alexis is forced to defend Manny Ruiz, much to Ric's dismay. Sonny and Emily spend Christmas together with Michael and Morgan, while Carly remains at Roselawn.

<summary>Gus discovers he has a son with Natalia, who kept it a secret from him. Beth and Alan argue over her desire for independence and her plans to visit a friend in Paris. Daisy and Rafe bond in juvie, while Harley struggles with her own issues. Alan follows Beth and confronts her about her plans. Rick and Mel discuss their co-parenting and Rick's plans to fight Alan for custody. Reva checks on Lizzie, who is unconscious. Natalia goes to the police station to find Rafe.</summary>

<summary>
Lizzie tries to start a new tradition with her family, but Beth wants to go to the Bauer barbecue to help Rick. Rick is struggling with the end of his marriage to Beth and doesn't want to host the barbecue. Cassie and Josh decide to host it instead. Bill and Ava attend the barbecue, but Bill is distant with Ava. Rick and Beth have a heart-to-heart talk and decide to remain friends. Alan falls and injures himself at the park. Remy tells Lizzie that he asked Ava to run away with him before the wedding. Bill and Ava have a tense moment at the barbecue.</summary>

Reva decides to take her job back at the bar, much to Nate's delight. Meanwhile, Tammy and Sandy's relationship is strained after Jonathan's interference, and Edmund offers to help Cassie with RJ's party, causing tension with Jeffrey.

<summary>
Alan confesses to shooting Phillip and is arrested. Dinah reveals her miscarriage to Edmund, who is still in love with Cassie. Cassie and Edmund agree to co-parent their baby. Lizzie is devastated by Alan's confession. Alexandra reveals evidence linking Alan to the crime. Frank arrests Harley, but she is later cleared. Olivia accuses Alexandra of being an accessory. Jonathan and Tammy argue over her feelings for him. Reva suspects Jonathan of killing Olivia's sister.</summary>

<summary>Ben Reade remembers the scent of Mitch Hendon's aftershave from the night of his attack, leading Gus to believe Hendon is the murderer. Jeffrey O'Neill is evicted from the Beacon Hotel by Cassie, and he calls an unknown contact about a pickup. Eden confides in Tony that she's being framed for the murders, and he offers to help her prove her innocence. Cassie discovers Mitch Hendon on the roof of the Beacon Hotel.</summary>

<summary>
Alexandra and Cyrus attend a charity event, where Cyrus secretly plans to embezzle funds. Marina, on police detail, suspects Cyrus' intentions. Meanwhile, Alan arrives with Natalia, causing tension with Gus. Vanessa attends with Billy, upsetting Matt. Harley confronts Cyrus about his intentions with Marina. Gus and Natalia share a dance, causing Alan to feel jealous. Dinah confesses her feelings for Matt, while Mallet faces consequences for his past actions. Alexandra and Vanessa bond over their respective relationship issues. Marina catches Cyrus in the act and confronts him.
</summary>

<summary>Shayne returns to Springfield but keeps his distance from Reva, while Lizzie is released from the hospital and decides to stay with Bill. Alan invites Beth to join him on a business trip to China, but she declines to attend a law workshop in Minneapolis instead. Coop continues to write about his affair with Beth, much to Buzz's disapproval. Josh finds Shayne and assures Reva that he's safe, but Shayne decides to leave town again. Lizzie and Bill spend Christmas Eve together, and she encourages him to follow a lead in his case.</summary>

Todd and Blair confess their love for each other and decide to give their relationship another chance. Meanwhile, Asa and Rae continue their power struggle over their divorce, with Asa trying to sign the divorce papers and Rae attempting to stop him.

<summary>
Jessica brings Chloe to church for her christening, with Natalie and Jared as godparents. Cole confesses to Starr that he helped her father find out about her relationship with Mr. Joplin. Markko tells Langston that Cole asked him for a urine sample to pass a drug test in rehab. Starr finds out that Hope's death was not caused by Rh disease. Todd and Téa have sex, but Téa refuses to help Todd get custody of his children. Nora and Bo find a knife with Blair's blood and John's fingerprint in Rosen's motel room. Jessica visits Nash's grave and talks to Chloe about her father. Cole promises Hope that he will find out why she died.</summary>

Todd Manning is arrested for pushing Marty Saybrooke down the stairs, causing her to lose her baby. Dani is torn between believing Todd's innocence and Cole's account of the events. Jessica asks Brody to the prom, and they bond over their shared history. Rex receives a lead on his biological mother from a jeweler in Santa Fe. Langston confesses to Markko that she has feelings for Ford, causing Markko to storm out. Téa reveals to Blair that she is dying, and Todd tells Dani that he will always be there for her.

<summary>
Natalie and Paul decide not to spend the night together, and Natalie learns about Viki's heart condition. Michael suspects Dr. Long is stalking him and asks John for help. Marcie decides to confront Dr. Long to get evidence against him. Viki has a heart attack and is hospitalized. John decides to move on from his past and asks Nora for advice. Dorian visits Viki in the hospital and learns about a risky procedure that could help her.
</summary>

<summary>
John plays a recording of a baby crying for Miles, who seems unconcerned. Marty is attacked by three men but escapes. John suspects Miles of being involved. Blair learns about Jessica's situation and offers to be tested as a donor. Viki and Clint decide to research experimental treatments for Jessica. Antonio is heartbroken and disowns Cristian. Nash reassures Jessica about their love.
</summary>

<summary>
Nora and Clint argue about Dorian's behavior, while Dorian apologizes to Clint for her actions. Marty struggles with Miles' blackmail, while Blair and Rex search for Todd in Chicago. Viki offers David Vickers a place to stay, but on her terms. Sarah is taken to the police station for questioning about Todd's whereabouts. Miles tries to woo Marty, but she remains distant. Blair returns to Llanview, leaving Rex and Cristian to continue the search for Todd. John drinks alone at a bar, while Miles tries to impress Marty with his physical prowess.
</summary>

<summary>
Viki confronts Marcie about her role in the "Killing Club" book and Natalie's kidnapping. John and Marcie search for clues to find Natalie. Rex blames himself for Natalie's disappearance. Antonio receives a note from Jessica, but Viki is worried about her safety. Tess steals a car from a valet. Bo receives a visit from Todd, who asks him to put out an A.P.B. on Jessica. Rex and Lindsay support each other through their shared grief. John and Marcie decide to work together to find Natalie. Antonio and Viki discuss Jessica's whereabouts and her need for space. A man's car is stolen by Tess, who claims to be his wife.
</summary>

Tess and Nash bond over wine and Nash encourages Tess to let go of her past. Rex and Marcie are held hostage by Hayes Barber, who plans to kill them. John and Bo interrogate Nick, who reveals that Natalie is dead.

<summary>
Kelly is upset by David Vickers' presence in Llanview and his claim to be in love with Dorian. Dorian tries to convince Blair to give Todd a chance. Antonio's custody hearing continues, with Evangeline Williamson testifying on his behalf. Blair and Todd share a romantic moment at Crossroads. The judge grants Antonio joint custody of Jamie. Marcie tries to boost Al's spirits by singing to him on the radio. Larry tells Max that Al needs a liver transplant to survive.
</summary>

<summary>
Rex and Kelly get stuck in the steam room together and discuss their respective relationship problems. Gigi confronts Adriana about Rex's comments about their sex life. Cole says goodbye to Starr and Hope before going to prison. John finds out about Natalie's amniocentesis and they argue about it. Eddie shows up at Ford and James' apartment and causes tension. Inez reveals that Nate is Eddie's son. Starr and Cole say their goodbyes. Ford and James decide to stay with Eddie to protect each other. Natalie and John make up. Cole is taken to prison by John and Starr watches them leave.</summary>

<summary>
Whitney is back in Harmony and considering singing at Liz's club, the Blue Note, despite her mother's disapproval. Eve is worried that Whitney will follow in her footsteps and get involved in the music business again. Rebecca is plotting to evict Pilar and her family from their home. Ethan is forced to deliver the eviction notice to the Lopez-Fitzgeralds. Theresa is trying to protect her son, little Ethan, from Rebecca's abuse. Kay and Miguel are growing closer as they support each other through their respective struggles. Liz is manipulating Whitney into singing at the Blue Note to upset Eve. Rebecca is enjoying the power she has over the Lopez-Fitzgeralds and is looking forward to evicting them.</summary>

The episode revolves around the aftermath of a fire at the Crane estate, where Sheridan and Luis were trapped. Eve, Antonio's wife, is at the hospital treating them. Meanwhile, T.C. is at home with Liz, who is trying to seduce him. Julian and Rebecca have hired a man named Tom Joyner to help them get rid of Theresa, but he has his own agenda. Chad and Whitney have reunited, and they plan to go public with their relationship.

<summary>
Eve and T.C. argue over Whitney's decision to give up her baby for adoption, with Eve denying any involvement and T.C. blaming her. Liz and Julian suggest adopting the baby, causing a rift between the couples. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa argue over Jane's custody, with Gwen threatening to kill Theresa. Sheridan insists on a D.N.A. test to prove Marty is her son, but Beth refuses. Ethan struggles with choosing between Gwen and Theresa, while Fox offers his support. Luis insists on the D.N.A. test to end the debate over Marty's parentage. Gwen considers killing Theresa to prevent her from taking Jane and Ethan away.
</summary>

<summary>
Whitney's mother, Eve, has suddenly changed her mind and is supporting Whitney's decision to move to L.A. with Chad, which is causing a rift between Eve and her husband, T.C. Eve reveals that she did it to protect Whitney, but T.C. is still upset and confused. Meanwhile, the search for Sheridan has been called off after an email was received stating that she is safe in Paris. Luis, however, is not convinced and plans to fly to Paris to find her. Kay's water breaks prematurely, and she goes into labor. Tabitha gives birth to a demon child, which Charity witnesses and is now determined to expose. Julian confesses to starting the fire at the Blue Note, but T.C. suspects that there is more to the story.</summary>

<summary>
Spike confronts Jessica's family about their intervention, threatening to expose her past if she testifies against him. Jessica chooses to stay with Spike, upsetting her family. Meanwhile, Fancy and Chris discuss their insecurities about Luis and Sheridan's relationship. Luis tries to win Sheridan back, while Gwen and Ethan argue about strange noises coming from their hotel room. Kay and Miguel find themselves in a mysterious, romantic location together, while Theresa and Jared discover Rebecca and J.T. making love on the hotel ledge.
</summary>

<summary>Kay is torn between her love for Fox and her desire to marry Miguel, while Fox is desperate to keep her. Rebecca is taking care of Ethan, who is unconscious, while Gwen is trying to bribe J.T. to leave town. Luis is searching for Fancy in a cave, with Sheridan and Paloma, while Chris is also present. Theresa is trying to outbid Gwen to win Ethan's affection. Fox has received bad news from his doctor, which Kay overhears. Luis and Fancy are in danger in the cave, while Rebecca is with Ethan. Theresa and Gwen are arguing over who won the bid for J.T.'s silence, with Theresa planning to expose Gwen and Rebecca to Ethan.</summary>

<summary>Karen and Kevin argue about his drug addiction, with Karen refusing to help him find his supplier, Frank. Kevin claims he's working with a doctor to kick the habit. Ian struggles with his vampire hunger and asks Chris for more blood. Lucy agrees to help Elizabeth find Alison using her intuition and tarot cards. Alison and Joshua discuss their pasts, with Alison accusing Joshua of killing her father. Rafe confronts Jamal, who was following him, and knocks him out. Lisa finds Jamal unconscious and offers to help.</summary>

<summary>
Sharon seeks Victor's help to prove Adam's innocence, but Victor warns her about Adam's dangerous nature. Daisy escapes from custody, taking her newborn baby with her. Daniel is found unconscious and hypothermic after trying to help Daisy. Phyllis is worried about Daniel's condition and blames herself for not keeping Daisy in prison. The police find a clue that Daisy crossed the Canadian border. Tucker is planning a wedding, and Sofia is struggling with a report from Blake. Heather is served with legal papers.
</summary>

<summary>
Victor's forensic accounting report clears him of any wrongdoing, but Vance Abrams argues that Victor's planned sale of a Dubai subsidiary could devalue Newman Enterprises, leading Judge Phelps to order one-third of Newman's assets frozen in escrow. Victor accuses Victoria and Abby of destroying the company, while Victoria blames Victor for teaching her to lie and manipulate. Sharon meets with Spencer Walsh, who remains skeptical about Skye's presence in Hawaii despite Jack's findings. Ronan reveals his liver disease to Nina, who offers to donate a part of her liver to him. Paul and Heather listen to Chance's wire recording and suspect that Ronan was shooting blanks, not live ammunition. Adam and Sharon discuss the challenges of proving Skye's presence in Hawaii, while Victor receives a threatening phone call.
</summary>

Lily and Tyler get stuck in an elevator, and Lily helps Tyler cope with his claustrophobia by telling him stories. Fenmore is accused of pushing Jamie off a roof, and Jamie confirms the accusation. Lauren and Paul are torn between believing their son Fenmore or Jamie. Chelsea meets with Cane to discuss her fashion designs, and Anita encourages Chelsea to find a new man to move on from Adam.

Victor is shocked to learn that Nick has been secretly buying up Jabot's debt to foreclose on the company. Jack calls an emergency shareholder meeting to propose that Chancellor Industries buy a 51% stake in Jabot to prevent Victor from taking over. Drucilla begs Phyllis to stay out of her family's business regarding the paternity test results. Devon feels like an outsider in the Abbott family and is hurt that Drucilla forgot his birthday. Nick is humiliated when Victor outbids him for Jabot's debt and takes back control of Newman Enterprises. Jack puts forth a proposal to the Jabot shareholders to sell a majority stake to Chancellor Industries. Nikki votes in favor of the proposal, despite Victor's protests. Lily feels left out of her family's secrets and wonders who she can trust. Nick asks Nikki what she wants to talk about.

Gloria and Jeff move into the Abbott mansion, but Gloria's sons refuse to visit. Jack and Sharon begin moving out of the mansion, and Jack struggles with the emotional weight of leaving his childhood home. Adam and Victoria clash over business decisions at Newman Enterprises.

<summary>Adam Newman's body is identified, and the Newman ranch is searched by police. Sharon is indifferent to Adam's death, while Victor and Nick discuss their involvement. Phyllis discovers blood on Nick's jacket and asks Sharon for help. Abby meets Ryder at the Athletic Club, unaware of his connection to Sheila. Lauren is held captive by Ryder and Daisy, who are working for Sheila. Jack is questioned by the D.A. about his monogrammed handkerchief found near Adam's body. Victor admits to Owen that the blood on his watch belongs to Adam.</summary>

Genevieve is determined to marry Jack despite his reservations, while Nikki tries to stop him. Chelsea gives birth to Billy and Victoria's son, and Adam visits the baby, causing Victoria to lash out at him. Victor tries to pay Chelsea off to leave town, but she refuses.

Victor is upset that Genevieve sold Beauty of Nature to him without revealing that Adam had no authority to sell it. He's worried about the S.E.C. investigating the purchase. Phyllis is devastated that Lucy is with Daisy and blames Avery for helping Daisy get full custody. Daisy shows up at Lauren's store and threatens her, leading to Lauren pulling a gun on her and getting arrested. Devon celebrates the success of his new song with friends, but Neil leaves early to deal with a work issue.

<summary>Jack and Sharon discuss their feelings about Nick and Phyllis' anniversary; Lily returns to work, much to Neil's concern; Adam's acquisition is approved despite Victoria's objections; Gloria confronts Jeffrey about his relationship with Jill; Phyllis and Nick enjoy their treasure hunt and anniversary dinner; Kay advises Amber to take a chance on love; Lily and Cane argue about her return to work; Victor invites Victoria to dinner, but she declines.</summary>

Genevieve thanks Ethan for helping her, but Jill warns her to stay away from him. Billy finds out about Phyllis' pregnancy and Nick's proposal. Lauren's assault case is settled, and Daisy visits her to discuss wedding registry. Daniel tells Phyllis he's marrying Daisy and wants to elope.

Kevin visits John to plead for his mother's forgiveness, while Lily visits Cassie in the hospital. Michael gifts Lauren a necklace to make up for his lack of communication, and Daniel considers leaving Genoa City.

Nick and Sharon reminisce about Cassie's death, while Summer throws a party at Phyllis' penthouse with Fen and Kyle, leading to a confrontation between Nick and Kyle. Fen gets into a fight with Kyle, and Summer lies to her parents about the party. Nick takes Summer's car keys away and lectures her about her behavior. Phyllis tries to reason with Nick about Summer's independence. Lauren and Michael argue about their marriage, and Fen is upset about his parents' separation. Sharon feels lonely and lost, and Dr. Watkins encourages her to find a purpose beyond love. Kyle confesses to Jack that he has feelings for Summer, and Summer tells Courtney about her crush on Kyle.
Chloe decides to go to Fairview for help, while Dylan tries to find a way to put Ian behind bars. Nikki is upset about Ian's acquittal and Victor's involvement in the matter.
<summary>Nick has a vision of Cassie, who shows him how his actions have affected their family and others, leading him to realize he needs to change and return home to Sharon and Noah.</summary>

Victor Newman's company, Newman Enterprises, goes public with a successful IPO. Daisy Carter's parental rights hearing for her daughter Lucy begins, with Daisy testifying about her past actions and desire to be a mother. Diane Jenkins tells Victor she's pregnant with his child and collapses, leading to an ambulance ride to the hospital. Victor suffers a stroke at home while Diane is in the ambulance.

Kevin, who has been living with Chloe, faked her death, and is now in Genoa City to rescue her from Adam, has been lying to Michael about his whereabouts. Adam is suing Nick for full custody of Christian, and Nick has called Chelsea to warn her about Adam's intentions. Devon apologized to Elena for paying off her student loans without her consent, and they have agreed to communicate better in the future.

Kevin decides to move to Oregon with Bella, much to Michael and Esther's dismay. Nikki returns from her trip and practices for her concert, while Nick expresses his concerns about her health. Abby and Victor bond over the concert preparations, and Victor hopes it will bring the Newman family closer. Chelsea apologizes to Kevin for her behavior at Chloe's funeral.

Nick returns and confirms that the baby is his, but he chooses to stay with Sharon. Colleen confesses to Brad about the threatening notes and calls, but he brushes it off as an old background check by Victor. JT finds a witness who identifies Colleen's father as George Kaplan, the son of the murdered Kaplan family. Kevin pays Alex the $10,000, but Alex reveals he made a copy of the tape. Sharon thanks Jack for being her friend.

<summary>Phyllis is fired from "Restless Style" and plans to write a blog to defend herself; Victoria is offered jobs by Jack, Ashley, and Victor; Adam and Chelsea elope and return to a grand home; Victor tries to convince Victoria to return to Newman Enterprises; Jack secretly meets with Jabot board members to keep his position; Sharon and Victor's relationship is strained; Phyllis and Nick fight with Billy, who has installed cameras in the office; Gloria hires her son Michael to investigate Jeff and Anita's marriage claim; Cane finds Genevieve upset at the Chancellor estate.</summary>

<summary>Hilary and Devon's wedding day arrives, filled with love and anticipation. Hilary receives gifts from her friends for her "something old, new, borrowed, and blue." Mariah stays with Hilary while the others prepare for the ceremony. Hilary confides in Mariah about her health, hinting that her time may be limited. During the ceremony, Devon and Hilary exchange heartfelt vows, expressing their love and commitment to each other. After the ceremony, Hilary passes out, causing concern among her loved ones. Nate assures everyone that Hilary is being kept comfortable. Devon and Hilary's loved ones gather around them, supporting them during this emotional time.</summary>

<summary>
John Abbott has been hospitalized after suffering a minor stroke. His family is by his side, and there is hope that his sentence will be commuted to time served. Lily is back home but is struggling with her parents' divorce and her own marriage issues. Daniel is trying to win Lily back, but she is unsure about their future. Neil and Dru are at odds over how to handle Lily's situation, and Neil is considering leaving Dru. John's health takes a turn for the worse, and his family is rushed to his side.
</summary>

<summary>Victor Newman is presumed dead after a boat accident in Mexico, leaving his family and business in turmoil. Nikki, his wife, has gone missing, and his children are searching for her. Adam, Victor's son, has taken over Newman Enterprises and fired Victoria, appointing Brad Carlton as the new CEO. Jack Abbott is planning an exposé on Victor's death for "Restless Style" magazine, which upsets Nick Newman. Jill Abbott is facing backlash for her role in the David Chow scandal, and Cane Ashby and Chloe Mitchell have secretly married. Heather Stevens has been offered a job at Newman Enterprises and is moving in with Adam. Paul Williams is heading to Mexico to search for Nikki, and Victoria is determined to protect her father's legacy at Newman.</summary>

<summary>
Murphy reads Katherine's letter asking everyone to write their thoughts and feelings, then burn the letters to send the smoke to her. Everyone writes letters, including Nikki who struggles with her emotions. After the ceremony, Nikki seems unwell, and Victor takes her home. Jill and Colin decide to continue the party at their house, while Neil and Devon dance with Hilary. Jill has a private moment at the park, reflecting on her journey with Colin and the music box.
</summary>

Billy tries to seduce Amber while Daniel and Colleen grow closer. Jill is cleared of charges and wants to work with Cane to control Chancellor Industries. River's daughter, Eden, is taken in by Michael and Lauren, while River's lawyer arrives.

Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters Foundation, blaming Billy for his decision. Billy and Ashley argue about Jack's actions and Billy's role in the affair. Phyllis visits Jack, asking for his forgiveness and expressing her love for him. Jack, however, is unforgiving and tells Phyllis to leave the house. Travis decides to move back in with Victoria, and they discuss their relationship.

<summary>Damon is in critical condition after a heart attack, and Phyllis is by his side. Kevin challenges Michael to a duel over Lauren. Lily confides in Kevin about her past traumas. Ashley and Brad discuss their divorce and its impact on their daughter, Abby. Victor and Nikki argue about Ashley's feelings for Victor. Jack agrees to help Nick find a job for Sharon at Jabot. Kevin threatens Devon, who is struggling with his father's death.</summary>

<summary>
Chance receives a medal for bravery, and Chloe feels jealous of Heather's attention towards him. Chance reassures Chloe that he only has eyes for her. Billy cheats on Mac with Kelly, and Mac decides to end their relationship. Daniel considers fleeing the country if he's arrested again, but Phyllis and Amber talk him out of it. Ryder is called to testify in front of a grand jury about the night of the murder. Heather files an arrest warrant for Daniel before the grand jury testimony. Michael tries to convince Heather to share the grand jury testimony with him, but she refuses. Daniel visits Ryder to try and get more information about the night of the murder. Daisy reveals that Ryder sent a rat to Lauren on Daniel's wedding night. Michael reassures Phyllis that he will do everything he can to help Daniel. Mac tells Billy that she can't be with him anymore because he cheated on her. Chloe visits Billy at "Restless Style" to get her purse and sees him wallowing in self-pity. She tells him that she doesn't love him anymore.
</summary>

Victoria suspects she may be pregnant, but hasn't confirmed it yet. Billy gives her a pregnancy test as a gift. Chloe and Kevin give each other Christmas gifts, and Kevin offers to raise Daisy's baby.
Devon and Hilary reconcile, with Hilary returning to GC Buzz as host and executive producer. Billy visits Jack's house on Christmas Eve, but Jack refuses to let him stay for dinner.

Nick and Sharon are trying to reassure Faith that they still love her despite their separation, while Billy is upset that Victoria wants their daughter Katie to have the Newman last name. Meanwhile, Adam learns from his grandmother that his father committed suicide after losing his company to Victor Newman, and he vows to make Newman pay.

<summary>
Reed, Mattie's friend, was arrested for driving under the influence after Mattie called the police. Jill agreed to sell Chancellor Industries to Jack, but changed her mind after learning about Jabot's internal issues. Jack plans to hire a caregiver for Dina so he can return to work as Jabot's CEO. Ashley held a board meeting without Jack and passed an amendment requiring the CEO to work from an office at Jabot. Nick and Chelsea decided to stay in their current penthouse instead of building a new house. Devon confronted Hilary about her relationship with Cane. Cane and Jill discussed Jill's New Year's Eve party, where Cane plans to make an appearance. Lily and Mattie argued about Reed's arrest.
</summary>
